title: Aga Khan University AKU Hiring Enumerator
description: 31 Chartered in 1983, Aga Khan University AKU is a private, autonomous, and self-governing international university, with 13 teaching sites in 6 countries over three continents. An integral part of the Aga Khan Development Network, AKU provides higher education in multiple health science and social science disciplines, carries out research pertinent primarily to low- and middle-income countries and operates 7 hospitals soon 8 and over 325 outreach clinics, all at international standards. It has almost 2,500 students and 14,000 staff. The University is both a model of academic excellence and an agent of social change. As a leading international institution dedicated to excellence and change, AKU operates on the core principles of quality, relevance, impact, and access. IHDs vision is to drive innovation in research in early human development that advances the quality of individual lives and contributes to building successful pluralistic societies. IHD generates new knowledge through basic and applied research, apply the knowledge gained through research to inform programmes, services and practices within community settings, influence policy formulation and implementation in ways that reap the benefits of the systematic research produced at the institute and elsewhere. The institute also delivers educational programmes at multiple levels of study to prepare a wide range of human development specialists and professionals. Job Summary The Field Enumerator will contribute to collaborative research that transforms maternal and child health outcomes through innovative data science by supporting participant tracing, informed consent, and data collection for the KIPMAT study while adhering to standard operating procedures and ethical regulations. KIPMAT is a study focused on developing and validating Artificial IntelligenceMachine Learning  based prediction models for poor maternal, neonatal, and early childhood outcomes at the Kenyan Coast Responsibilities Administer structured questionnaires and study tools to mothers and children during home visits and clinic-based assessments. Ensure accurate and complete documentation of responses in Case Report Forms CRFs and electronic data capture systems. Support the informed consent and assent process by explaining study procedures to participants in local languages e.g., Kiswahili, Kigiriama and Mijikenda. Ensure participants feel comfortable during interviews and assessments, allowing breaks or withdrawal at any time. Assist in locating and scheduling visits with eligible participants. Support logistical planning for field activities, including transportation, meal coordination, and participant reimbursements. Ensure data collected meets quality standards and is consistent with study protocols. Adhere to Good Clinical Practice GCP and research governance guidelines. Maintain confidentiality and securely handle participant information. Work closely with clinicians, assessors, and other fieldworkers to ensure smooth implementation of study activities. Perform any other duties assigned by the Principal Investigator. Requirements A minimum of diploma in Public Health, Nursing, Clinical Medicine, psychology or related course; a background in health sciences is desirable. Relevant Experience At least 1 year working experience in research Flexible  able to work extra hours when needed Familiarity with neurodevelopmental and mental health assessments is desirable. Fluency in English and Kiswahili; knowledge of local languages Kigiriama or Mijikenda is an added advantage. Personal Characteristics  Behaviours Can work under minimal supervision. Highly organized and attentive to detail. Excellent interpersonal skills and a good team player. Keen desire to learn and share knowledge. Apply

title: Zetech University
description: 37 The institution announces several career opportunities across academic and leadership roles within its various schools and faculties. These positions are part of an ongoing effort to strengthen academic delivery, enhance research capacity, and support the advancement of higher education standards. Applicants are invited to review the detailed job descriptions for each role and submit applications before the stipulated deadlines. The institution emphasizes a fair and merit-based recruitment process and advises all prospective applicants that it does not request any form of payment at any stage of hiring. All meetings and interviews will be conducted strictly within the institutions official locations at the Ruiru Campus or the Technology Park, Mangu. This announcement includes the following vacancies:  Dean Ref: ZU10Adv592025  Dean  Computer Engineering Ref: ZU10Adv602025  Tutorial Fellow  Electrical and Electronic Engineering Ref: ZU10Adv522025  Tutorial Fellow  Information Technology Ref: ZU10Adv502025  Tutorial Fellow  Data Analytics Ref: ZU10Adv662025  Senior Lecturer  International Faculty  Information Communication Technology Ref: ZU10Adv672025  Senior Lecturer  International Faculty  Nursing Ref: ZU10Adv682025 Each position is presented with a comprehensive job description outlining the scope of responsibilities and expectations. INTRODUCTION The institution continues to expand its academic footprint, driven by a commitment to delivering high-quality education, fostering research excellence, and supporting the development of skilled graduates ready to contribute to technological, scientific, and societal advancement. In line with this mission, opportunities have arisen for qualified individuals to join the academic and administrative teams across several schools. These roles are designed to strengthen academic leadership, enhance curriculum delivery, and support the growing demand for innovative teaching and learning approaches. The advertised positions span senior academic leadership, lecturing, and early-career teaching roles. Each vacancy carries defined responsibilities that focus on the overall advancement of academic standards, student mentorship, research development, and effective departmental management. The following sections provide detailed job descriptions for each advertised role, ensuring applicants have clear insight into the duties associated with the positions. DEAN Ref: ZU10Adv592025 Date Posted: Nov 11th, 2025 15:49 Closing Date: Dec 12th, 2025 Job Description The Dean will provide strategic direction, academic oversight, and administrative leadership for the assigned school. The role involves formulating and implementing academic policies, coordinating the development and review of curricula, and ensuring alignment with institutional and regulatory standards. The Dean will lead the schools academic planning processes, support faculty development, and promote a culture of academic excellence and integrity. The position requires overseeing the delivery of academic programs, ensuring their relevance and quality, and facilitating effective teaching and learning practices. The Dean will be responsible for supervising departmental heads, guiding academic staff in performance management, and ensuring adherence to teaching schedules, assessment procedures, and academic regulations. The role further includes coordination of research activities within the school, promotion of interdisciplinary collaboration, and facilitation of grant proposal development. The Dean will represent the school in internal committees and external engagements, fostering partnerships that strengthen academic programs and research output. Administrative responsibilities include budget planning and management, resource allocation, staff recruitment processes within the school, and ensuring compliance with institutional governance frameworks. The Dean will also play a key role in student affairs, addressing academic concerns, supporting student development initiatives, and ensuring that learning environments meet required standards of quality and safety. DEAN  COMPUTER ENGINEERING Ref: ZU10Adv602025 Date Posted: Nov 11th, 2025 15:50 Closing Date: Dec 12th, 2025 Job Description The Dean  Computer Engineering will provide leadership for the School of Computer Engineering, ensuring the schools programs are competitive, industry-aligned, and driven by technological advancement. The role involves coordinating the planning, development, and implementation of engineering curricula that reflect current and emerging trends in computing technologies. The Dean will oversee teaching activities within the school, ensuring that course delivery meets established standards and that instructional methodologies encourage innovation, problem-solving, and applied learning. This includes supervision of academic staff, facilitation of continuous professional development, and ensuring the availability of adequate laboratory and teaching resources. The position requires active involvement in research planning and execution, encouraging faculty participation in grant applications, publications, and collaborative projects with industry partners. The Dean will support the creation of research clusters, foster innovation, and promote integration of research outputs into teaching practices. Administrative duties include financial planning for the school, monitoring budget utilization, coordinating recruitment within the faculty, and ensuring compliance with academic regulations and accreditation requirements. The Dean will work closely with departmental heads to address student academic challenges, oversee examinations and assessments, and safeguard the academic integrity of all programs. The role also involves cultivating external partnerships, including collaborations with technology industries, professional bodies, and academic institutions, to enhance program relevance and graduate employability. TUTORIAL FELLOW  ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING Ref: ZU10Adv522025 Date Posted: Dec 1st, 2025 08:29 Closing Date: Dec 12th, 2025 Job Description The Tutorial Fellow  Electrical and Electronic Engineering will support the delivery of undergraduate programs within the discipline. The position focuses on assisting senior academic staff in teaching, conducting practical sessions, guiding students through laboratory work, and facilitating discussion groups. Key responsibilities include preparing teaching materials, supporting the implementation of instructional plans, and ensuring that laboratory equipment is properly maintained and utilized. The Tutorial Fellow will assist in supervising student projects, offering academic mentorship, and providing technical guidance to help students understand theoretical and practical concepts. The role involves contributing to assessment processes by preparing tutorial exercises, supporting examination administration, and providing feedback to students under the supervision of senior lecturers. The Tutorial Fellow will also participate in departmental meetings, contribute to curriculum development discussions when required, and support quality assurance activities. Additional responsibilities include maintaining student records for academic progress, ensuring adherence to safety standards within laboratories, and supporting research activities where applicable. The position is intended to enhance the overall teaching and learning experience within the department. TUTORIAL FELLOW  INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY Ref: ZU10Adv502025 Date Posted: Dec 1st, 2025 10:36 Closing Date: Dec 12th, 2025 Job Description The Tutorial Fellow  Information Technology will support the academic delivery of IT programs by assisting senior faculty in teaching, practical instruction, and student supervision. The role includes preparation of learning materials, conduction of tutorial sessions, and facilitation of student engagement in class activities and laboratory exercises. The position requires active participation in practical sessions related to programming, networks, databases, and other core IT domains. The Tutorial Fellow will help maintain laboratory environments, ensure software and hardware resources are functional, and support students in troubleshooting technical challenges. The role includes supporting student assessment processes, marking assignments where assigned, and providing guided academic support under supervision. The Tutorial Fellow will contribute to departmental meetings, curriculum reviews, and quality enhancement initiatives. The position also involves participating in departmental research projects where applicable, maintaining records related to student performance, and enforcing adherence to institutional academic guidelines. The role aims to contribute to consistent delivery of comprehensive and up-to-date IT instruction. TUTORIAL FELLOW  DATA ANALYTICS Ref: ZU10Adv662025 Date Posted: Dec 4th, 2025 06:36 Closing Date: Dec 18th, 2025 Job Description The Tutorial Fellow  Data Analytics will support teaching and research activities in the field of data analytics, including statistical analysis, data modelling, quantitative methods, and applied computing. The role includes guiding students through practical exercises involving data tools, supporting coursework delivery, and assisting senior lecturers in creating course content. Responsibilities include conducting tutorials, assisting students in using analytical software, and supervising practical sessions in data exploration, visualization, and machine learning fundamentals. The Tutorial Fellow will also participate in marking assignments when delegated, preparing learning materials, and ensuring that laboratory and software resources are up to date. The role contributes to supporting departmental research activities, collecting data for ongoing studies, and participating in academic discussions related to curriculum development and program enhancement. Administrative tasks include maintaining academic records, supporting student advising efforts, and helping ensure compliance with academic standards and policies. SENIOR LECTURER  INTERNATIONAL FACULTY  INFORMATION COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY Ref: ZU10Adv672025 Date Posted: Dec 4th, 2025 09:16 Closing Date: Jan 31st, 2026 Job Description The Senior Lecturer  International Faculty  Information Communication Technology will contribute to teaching, research, and academic leadership within the ICT discipline. The role involves delivering advanced coursework, supervising student projects and postgraduate research, and developing instructional content that aligns with global and emerging trends in ICT. The position requires active engagement in curriculum development, ensuring that course content remains aligned with technological advancements and industry needs. The Senior Lecturer will participate in peer review processes, contribute to academic publications, and collaborate with other faculty in interdisciplinary research initiatives. Additional responsibilities include mentoring junior academic staff, participating in academic committees, and strengthening international academic partnerships. title: Co-operative Bank
description: 43 An established financial institution is inviting applications from skilled, innovative and forward-thinking professionals to fill several key positions across its technology, engineering, data, and commercial functions. As part of its continued commitment to strengthening operational capacity, improving service delivery, and driving digital transformation, the institution seeks individuals who can bring fresh perspectives, strong technical capabilities, and a solutions-oriented approach. These opportunities span diverse areas including software development, data analytics, engineering, business intelligence, product design, and sales leadership. Each position offers a unique platform for professionals to contribute to high-impact projects that support the banks strategic ambition of delivering reliable, efficient and customer-centric solutions. The roles require individuals who can thrive in structured environments, collaborate effectively in cross-functional teams, and execute responsibilities with precision. The following sections provide detailed job descriptions for each vacancy. Prospective candidates are encouraged to review the information carefully and evaluate how their experience and competencies align with the needs of the respective roles. The institution values applicants who demonstrate consistency, depth of skill, and a commitment to excellence across all areas of professional engagement. FRONT-END DEVELOPER The Front-End Developer will be responsible for implementing user-facing features for various digital platforms within the institution. This role includes translating UIUX design wireframes into responsive, high-performing code that ensures an optimized user experience. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with designers, back-end engineers, and product teams to deliver seamless, intuitive and visually consistent digital interfaces. Key responsibilities include developing new user-facing components and functionality, enhancing existing platform features, optimizing applications for speed and scalability, and ensuring the technical feasibility of UIUX designs. The role also requires maintaining code quality using structured development standards, participating in systems reviews, troubleshooting interface-related issues, and contributing to continuous improvement initiatives in the front-end development space. ANDROID DEVELOPER The Android Developer will take part in the design, development, enhancement and maintenance of the institutions Android applications. The position focuses on creating high-quality mobile applications that adhere to industry best practices and internal performance standards. The developer is expected to work within agile development environments and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that application modules integrate seamlessly with other systems. Core duties include coding application features, implementing secure mobile architecture, identifying and resolving technical bottlenecks, performing application performance tuning, and ensuring compatibility across various Android devices and OS versions. The role also involves conducting code reviews, preparing technical documentation, and adopting development frameworks that ensure consistency, maintainability and security across mobile products. USER EXPERIENCE DESIGNER The User Experience Designer will be responsible for shaping the overall experience and usability of digital products across the institutions service platforms. This role requires detailed research, user behaviour analysis and the creation of information architectures that guide the development of intuitive systems. Key functions include conducting user research, developing conceptual models, crafting wireframes, storyboards and prototypes, and ensuring that interface designs reflect user needs and business objectives. The designer will collaborate with developers to validate designs, test usability across multiple platforms, conduct iterative improvements based on feedback, and ensure that all digital products meet accessibility and user satisfaction standards. iOS DEVELOPER The iOS Developer will focus on building, improving and maintaining applications for the iOS ecosystem. The role involves translating technical requirements into robust mobile solutions while ensuring compliance with Apple development standards and best practices. The successful individual will work closely with product owners, designers and back-end teams to achieve consistency across mobile platforms. Main responsibilities include coding new application features, integrating APIs, managing version control, optimizing application performance, and ensuring compatibility with multiple iOS devices and versions. The developer will also perform testing, troubleshoot errors, review peer code, and prepare related documentation. The role demands attention to detail and strong adherence to security requirements in mobile development. FULL STACK DEVELOPER The Full Stack Developer will work on end-to-end software development initiatives, building both client-side and server-side components for digital systems. The role is suited for an individual with extensive understanding of system architecture, back-end logic, front-end frameworks and integration mechanisms. Responsibilities include designing scalable system architectures, building and maintaining application APIs, writing reusable code libraries, developing user-facing components, and integrating database systems. The developer will collaborate with cross-functional teams, ensure adherence to development standards, troubleshoot issues across the full development lifecycle and support continuous deployment activities. This position requires strong analytical thinking and the ability to manage complex development cycles. DATA ENGINEER The Data Engineer will support the setup, maintenance and optimization of data pipelines across the institutions data infrastructure. The role requires building scalable architectures that enable efficient extraction, transformation and loading of structured and unstructured data. Duties include designing and maintaining data pipelines, managing data workflows, optimizing data storage systems, ensuring data quality and reliability, and supporting analytics teams by providing clean, well-structured data sets. The engineer will also be responsible for monitoring pipeline performance, implementing data governance practices, automating data integration processes, and supporting upgrades to the data architecture to meet emerging business needs. BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE BI DEVELOPER The Business Intelligence Developer will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining business intelligence solutions that support data-driven decision-making within the organization. The role requires a deep understanding of reporting tools, data structures and business processes. Core tasks include developing BI dashboards and reports, translating business requirements into analytical solutions, identifying trends and patterns from data sets, ensuring data accuracy in reporting, and maintaining BI platforms. The BI Developer will collaborate with stakeholders to determine reporting needs, support system testing activities, manage report automation and ensure the integrity, security and availability of business intelligence resources. ELECTRICAL ENGINEER The Electrical Engineer will support the installation, maintenance and monitoring of electrical systems across the institutions facilities. This includes involvement in preventive and corrective maintenance activities, system upgrades, energy management and ensuring compliance with technical and safety standards. Key responsibilities include designing electrical system layouts, conducting inspections, diagnosing system faults, supervising installations, preparing technical documentation and coordinating with contractors and vendors. The engineer will take part in project planning, support risk assessments, ensure adherence to regulatory standards and contribute to the reliability and efficiency of all electrical equipment and infrastructure. DATA ARCHITECT The Data Architect will oversee the design and implementation of the institutions overall data architecture, ensuring that data assets are structured, secured and optimized for both current and future business needs. This role requires a strategic approach to data modeling and system integration. Responsibilities include defining data architecture frameworks, building scalable data models, establishing data governance protocols, evaluating system capabilities, and aligning architectural designs with business objectives. The architect will also collaborate with data engineers, analysts and software teams to streamline data flows, enhance data accessibility, and maintain robust metadata management practices. Leadership in architectural planning and strong conceptual thinking are essential for this role. DATA SCIENTIST The Data Scientist will provide advanced analytical insights by applying statistical, machine learning and predictive modeling techniques to support strategic decisions across the institution. The role focuses on interpreting complex data sets, generating actionable insights and guiding business leaders on analytical outcomes. Key duties include collecting and analyzing large data sets, applying algorithmic techniques, building predictive models, validating model outcomes, and presenting insights through data visualization. The Data Scientist will work closely with various departments to identify opportunities for analytics-driven improvements, monitor model performance, refine algorithms and ensure adherence to analytical standards and ethical data use. HEAD  CASH MANAGEMENT SALES The Head  Cash Management Sales will lead the institutions cash management sales function, driving revenue growth, business development and strategic client engagement. This senior position requires strong commercial acumen, leadership capability and an understanding of transaction banking solutions. Primary responsibilities include developing sales strategies for cash management products, leading the sales team, managing key corporate relationships, identifying new market opportunities and overseeing product performance. The role also includes coordinating with product, operations and technology teams to streamline solution delivery, monitoring market trends, conducting competitor analysis, and preparing periodic performance reports for management. The position requires strong communication, strategic planning and team oversight abilities. CONCLUSION These positions offer an opportunity for professionals across diverse technical and commercial fields to contribute to the institutions continuous growth and digital transformation efforts. Each role requires a high level of responsibility, precision and commitment to supporting operational excellence. Individuals with relevant experience are encouraged to consider applying for a position that aligns with their skills and interests. Apply Now

title: Safaricom Need Big Data Engineer
description: 132 Big Data Engineer Nairobi, Kenya Trending Job Description Brief Description Reporting to DataOps Engineering Lead . The Big Data Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable big data solutions to enable efficient storage, processing, and analysis of large volumes of data. You will work closely with cross-functional teams including data scientists, data analysts, and software engineers to build and optimize data pipelines and systems. This role requires expertise in big data technologies, database management, and software engineering best practices. Key Responsibilities Data Pipeline Development : Design, implement, and maintain robust data pipelines for ingesting, processing, and transforming large volumes of structured and unstructured data. Develop ETL Extract, Transform, Load processes to cleanse, enrich, and aggregate data for analysis. Data Storage Solutions : Architect and optimize data storage solutions, including distributed file systems, NoSQL databases, and data warehouses. Implement data partitioning, indexing, and compression techniques to maximize storage efficiency and performance. Big Data Technologies : Utilize and optimize big data technologies and frameworks such as Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, Apache Flink, and Apache Kafka. Develop and maintain data processing jobs, queries, and analytics workflows using distributed computing frameworks and query languages. Scalability and Performance : Optimize data processing workflows for scalability, performance, and reliability. Implement parallel processing, distributed computing, and caching mechanisms to handle large-scale data processing workloads. Monitoring and Optimization : Develop monitoring and alerting solutions to track the health, performance, and availability of big data systems. Implement automated scaling, load balancing, and resource management mechanisms to optimize system utilization and performance. Data Quality and Governance : Ensure data quality and integrity throughout the data lifecycle. Implement data validation, cleansing, and enrichment processes to maintain high-quality data. Ensure compliance with data governance policies and regulatory standards. Collaboration and Documentation : Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and business objectives. Document data pipelines, system architecture, and best practices. Provide training and support to stakeholders on data engineering tools and technologies. Qualifications Bachelors or masters degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field. Proven professional SQL capabilities Solid understanding of big data technologies, distributed systems, and database management principles. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala. Experience with big data frameworks such as Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, or Apache Flink. Knowledge of database systems such as SQL databases, NoSQL databases, and distributed file systems. Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. How to Apply If you feel that you are up to the challenge and possess the necessary qualifications and experience, kindly proceed to update your candidate profile on the recruitment portal and then click on the apply button . Remember to attach your resume .

title: AMREF Flying Doctors Hiring Avionics Engineer  Nairobi, Kenya
description: 51 AMREF Flying Doctors, one of Africas most respected and reliable aero-medical service providers, is inviting qualified professionals to apply for the position of Avionics Engineer based in Nairobi, Kenya. As a subsidiary of Amref Health Africa, AMREF Flying Doctors plays a vital role in providing emergency air evacuation and air ambulance services across the African continent and beyond. The organization is dedicated to delivering swift and efficient air medical services while ensuring the highest safety and maintenance standards for its aircraft fleet. With decades of operational experience and a reputation built on trust, safety, and professionalism, AMREF Flying Doctors continues to expand its services to meet the growing demand for emergency and medical air transportation. Its operations are headquartered at Wilson Airport, Nairobi, where it maintains a fleet of dedicated air ambulances equipped with state-of-the-art medical and aviation technology. Patients in need of urgent care are evacuated from anywhere in Africa and can be transferred to destinations worldwide, including Europe, Asia, and North America. The organizations activities are closely aligned with Amref Health Africas mission to advance health and well-being across the continent. As part of its commitment to operational excellence, AMREF Flying Doctors is seeking an experienced and competent Avionics Engineer. The successful candidate will contribute to maintaining the safety, reliability, and airworthiness of the organizations aircraft fleet, ensuring compliance with aviation regulations and internal maintenance procedures. This role requires an individual with a high level of technical skill, precision, and dedication to safety in all aspects of aircraft maintenance. Main Job Purpose The Avionics Engineer is responsible for carrying out scheduled and unscheduled aircraft maintenance to ensure the continued airworthiness of AMREF Flying Doctors aircraft fleet. This includes ensuring compliance with the Kenya Civil Aviation Authority KCAA regulations, AMREF Flying Doctors maintenance procedures, and other applicable regulatory standards. The role demands a proactive approach to identifying and resolving avionics and system-related issues, maintaining high operational readiness, and ensuring that each aircraft is in optimal condition for safe flight operations. Detailed Job Description Aircraft Maintenance Scheduled and Unscheduled The Avionics Engineer will carry out both line and base maintenance as per the approved maintenance program. This includes performing scheduled checks, preventive maintenance, and necessary repairs to ensure that all aircraft systems are in perfect operational condition. The engineer will also be required to respond to unscheduled maintenance needs, including those occurring away from the base of operations, ensuring that any technical issue is resolved promptly and effectively. Troubleshooting and Repairs The role involves identifying, diagnosing, and resolving technical issues across electrical, avionics, and instrument systems. The Avionics Engineer will conduct inspections, functional tests, repairs, replacements, and modifications on aircraft systems, components, and equipment to maintain their airworthiness and performance integrity. Component Assembly and Disassembly The engineer will undertake assembly, disassembly, and necessary repairs during avionics repair or modification processes. This includes removal, replacement, or repair of engines, airframes, and other systems integral to avionics functionality. Defect Rectification and Certification The Avionics Engineer will ensure that all identified defects are rectified within approved timelines and that aircraft or components are certified accordingly before being released for service. Thorough documentation and verification of rectified issues will be mandatory before any flight operation. Cabin System Reviews and Rectification The engineer will review reported cabin defects, perform necessary rectifications, and ensure that all aircraft cabin systems are fully functional before the aircraft is cleared for missions. Reporting and Documentation Accurate reporting and documentation are essential aspects of this role. The engineer will be expected to record any abnormal wear, damage, or system irregularities and ensure that such issues are communicated promptly to the relevant supervisors. Supervision and Coordination The Avionics Engineer will supervise tasks carried out by technicians and ground operations personnel. This includes overseeing aircraft internal and external cleaning, refueling, and defueling processes, ensuring adherence to safety protocols and maintenance standards. Maintenance of Equipment and Premises The engineer will ensure that all maintenance tools, equipment, and facilities are maintained in accordance with industry standards. Regular inspections and calibration of equipment are essential to ensure operational accuracy and reliability. Technical Liaison and Collaboration The role involves active collaboration with flight crew, maintenance teams, and other departments to ensure effective communication regarding aircraft conditions, defects, and maintenance progress. The engineer will debrief flight crews to accurately define and document technical issues. Technical Analysis and Data Management The engineer will analyze and interpret technical information, maintenance data, and airworthiness directives. Additionally, they will ensure that all planned maintenance work is monitored to completion and accurately recorded in maintenance management systems. Inventory and Logistics Management The Avionics Engineer will liaise with the Stores Officer to manage technical tools, spare parts, and equipment. This includes identifying required replacement parts, verifying their airworthiness upon receipt, and preparing replaced parts for shipping or core exchange. Work Pack Management The engineer will review work packs and plan for necessary tools and materials required to complete maintenance checks efficiently. Proper planning and requisitioning will help ensure uninterrupted workflow and aircraft readiness. Audits and Compliance The Avionics Engineer will assist in audits of both internal maintenance operations and contracted Approved Maintenance Organizations AMOs. Responsibilities include verifying work package completeness, supporting audit programs, and ensuring compliance with regulatory and internal quality standards. Reliability Data and Reporting The engineer will collect, review, and analyze reliability data to ensure accuracy and correct classification under respective ATA chapters. They will also prepare and submit periodic reports, including fleet and component utilization, delay and availability reports, and warranty tracking summaries. Deferred Maintenance Control Daily management of deferred maintenance items will be part of this role. The engineer will prepare open defects and MEL Minimum Equipment List reports, ensuring timely updates and communication with relevant departments for operational planning. Engine and APU Monitoring Responsibilities include carrying out engine condition trend monitoring and maintaining accurate records of engine and auxiliary power unit APU performance data. This ensures early detection of performance deviations and supports predictive maintenance planning. Warranty and Contracted Support Oversight The engineer will monitor components under warranty and ensure that timely claims are filed. They will notify supervisors of expiring warranties and assist in managing maintenance relationships with contracted AMOs and service providers. Engineering Support and Cross-functional Collaboration The Avionics Engineer will work closely with the engineering unit and provide technical input on various projects and operational improvements. The role also involves supporting fleet management and technical decision-making processes. Additional Responsibilities The engineer will attend to other tasks and duties as assigned, including participation in internal quality improvement initiatives, safety audits, and operational reviews aimed at maintaining AMREF Flying Doctors high safety and maintenance standards. Knowledge, Skills, and Competencies The Avionics Engineer must demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of Kenya Civil Aviation Regulations KCARs, as well as detailed familiarity with avionics systems used in Citation business jets and Pilatus PC-12 aircraft. A strong focus on aircraft safety, precision in technical work, and the ability to interpret manufacturers publications and maintenance data are critical. The position also requires strong analytical and decision-making abilities, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and the capacity to work effectively both independently and as part of a team. Flexibility to handle multiple tasks and adapt to varied working hours is essential, given the operational demands of AMREF Flying Doctors. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, particularly Word and Excel, is also required. Work Environment AMREF Flying Doctors operates on a 24-hour schedule due to the nature of its aero-medical operations. The Avionics Engineer must therefore be prepared to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and public holidays, when operational requirements demand. The work environment emphasizes teamwork, adherence to safety protocols, and precise coordination among various operational departments. Application Process Individuals with a passion for contributing to the leading aero-medical and health solutions provider in Africa are encouraged to apply for this position. Interested candidates should submit their applications by Monday, 20th October 2025 . Applications can be submitted through the AMREF Flying Doctors career portal at: https:flydoc.orgcareer-opportunities or via the Amref Health Africa website at: https:amref.orgvacancies Applicants are advised that AMREF Flying Doctors does not charge any fees at any stage of the recruitment process. The organization has not engaged any third-party recruitment agents. While AMREF Flying Doctors occasionally posts vacancies on external job boards to reach a wider pool of candidates, the official and verified listings can always be found on the organizations website or its official social media pages. Official communication from AMREF Flying Doctors will only originate from an email address ending with flydoc.org . Applicants are therefore encouraged to remain vigilant and report any suspicious recruitment activities or correspondence. Safeguarding and Equal Opportunity Commitment AMREF Flying Doctors is committed to promoting and protecting the welfare of children, young people, and vulnerable adults. All employees are expected to uphold this safeguarding commitment in the course of their duties. The organization upholds principles of equality, inclusion, and non-discrimination in all employment decisions. It provides a smoke-free working environment and is an equal opportunity employer. description: 45 BAT is undergoing a dynamic transformation as it evolves into a global multi-category business. Guided by the vision of creating A Better Tomorrow through a smokeless world, the company continues to strengthen its operations and attract professionals who can help shape this journey. As part of its Operations Leaf function, BAT is seeking a highly skilled and experienced professional for the role of GLT Engineering  Maintenance Manager. This position is critical in ensuring the seamless operation of facilities, utilities, and equipment within the Green Leaf Threshing Plant GLT and the Leaf Center. The role encompasses leadership, project management, operational excellence, and relationship-building to drive both current productivity and future growth. The position reports to the GLT Manager, is classified at Grade 34, and will be based at all designated GLT and Leaf Center locations. Purpose of the Role The GLT Engineering  Maintenance Manager is responsible for overseeing capital expenditure projects, maintenance of buildings, utilities, and engineering assets. The role ensures cost-effective management of engineering operations, uninterrupted production, compliance with safety and legal standards, and the achievement of productivity targets. A key focus of this role is to guarantee continuous utility supply, including power, steam, air, water, and vacuum, to support both production and administration. Additionally, the position involves managing GLT and leaf machine maintenance, spare parts planning, and technical training, all aimed at maintaining optimum productivity, quality, and cost efficiency. Performance Expectations The performance of the GLT Engineering  Maintenance Manager will be assessed against the ability to deliver Co-plan targets, readiness for site growth, uninterrupted utility provision, and adherence to project schedules and budgets. Success in this role is measured by operational efficiency, regulatory compliance, employee development, and contribution to long-term strategic objectives. Principal Accountabilities The responsibilities of the GLT Engineering  Maintenance Manager are categorized into several key areas of accountability: Business Responsibilities Drive continuous improvement in equipment availability and efficiency, ensuring optimal Overall Equipment Effectiveness OEE. Manage all engineering-related areas, including utilities, environmental health and safety EHS, and facilities, in close collaboration with procurement and other departments to meet Co-plan objectives. Oversee plant maintenance programs, machinery overhauls, and modifications to guarantee smooth production operations. Ensure 100 percent availability of utilities such as electricity, steam, water, vacuum, and compressed air. Monitor and manage energy consumption across operations, identifying opportunities for cost savings and efficiency. Deliver capital and operational projects on time, within approved budgets, and aligned with BATs global technical and operational standards. Ensure full compliance with technical requirements, local laws, regulatory standards, and internal safety frameworks. Leadership Responsibilities Develop, lead, and maintain a motivated engineering team through coaching, mentoring, and succession planning. Promote an organizational culture of servant leadership and change readiness. Conduct performance evaluations regularly, identifying training needs and addressing performance gaps. Ensure continuous professional development of team members, encouraging talent retention and career growth. Support the adoption of lean manufacturing methodologies and integrated work systems within the department. Management Responsibilities Establish and monitor maintenance and service cost targets, ensuring compliance with Service Level Agreements SLAs and driving operational cost savings. Oversee the efficient management of operational expenditure Opex and capital expenditure Capex budgets. Ensure optimal control of spare parts, machinery registers, and related engineering resources. Guarantee adherence to BAT standards, policies, and procedures, as well as compliance with local statutory requirements. Relationship Responsibilities Build and sustain strong working relationships with internal departments, suppliers, contractors, and local authorities. Collaborate across all levels of the organization, including HR, Finance, Procurement, and EHS, to achieve operational synergy. Ensure safe and productive working conditions by reducing the risk of unplanned downtime in production. Foster constructive engagement with union staff and external regulatory agencies. Innovation Responsibilities Lead initiatives for continuous improvement in engineering and utilities management. Promote the adoption of best practices and encourage knowledge-sharing across BAT facilities. Drive innovative solutions to enhance efficiency, productivity, and sustainability in engineering operations. Knowledge, Skills, and Experience Required A degree or equivalent experience in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering with at least five years of plant or engineering experience. Practical experience in project management, with Project Management Professional PMP certification considered an advantage. Strong proficiency in IT systems, including Microsoft Office and SAP. Broad knowledge of factory operations and engineering processes. Demonstrated leadership skills with the ability to communicate effectively, manage contracts, and inspire teams. Proven experience in lean manufacturing, Six Sigma, Integrated Work Systems IWS, and Daily Management Systems DMS. Membership with a recognized professional engineering body. High level of self-motivation, discipline, and decision-making skills. Capacity to innovate and adapt in complex and challenging environments. Key Success Factors The role will be considered successful if the following outcomes are achieved: Timely delivery of capital and operational projects within set budgets. Achievement of high OEE levels, throughput, product yield, and quality standards. Maintenance of zero safety and environmental incidents across the GLT operations. Full compliance with statutory requirements and BATs internal standards. Effective management of utilities to ensure efficiency and continuity. Strengthening of staff capabilities and implementation of IWS in alignment with Co-plan objectives. Working Relationships The GLT Engineering  Maintenance Manager will collaborate with both internal and external stakeholders: Internal stakeholders include Leaf Operations departments, the GLT Plant Manager, HR, Finance, Procurement, EHS teams, and union representatives. External stakeholders include suppliers, contractors, utility providers, statutory authorities, and local government representatives. Career Development Opportunities This position offers exposure to complex engineering and operational challenges within a global business framework. The GLT Engineering  Maintenance Manager will be responsible for shaping strategies, implementing innovative engineering practices, and building strong technical teams. This role is designed for professionals seeking long-term growth and a career path that emphasizes leadership in manufacturing, engineering, and operations. Conclusion The GLT Engineering  Maintenance Manager is a pivotal role that ensures operational excellence, project delivery, and long-term sustainability within BATs GLT and Leaf operations. The position demands strong technical expertise, proven leadership, and the ability to balance strategic goals with day-to-day operational needs. Applicants with the required experience and proven capabilities are invited to submit their applications through the prescribed channels. Apply Now

title: Seven Four Eight Air Services Hiring Reliability Monitoring Engineer
description: 51 At Seven Four Eight Air Services K Limited, we are committed to operational excellence, safety, and innovation in the aviation industry. As a leading aviation company, we pride ourselves on delivering reliable and efficient air transport services across various markets. Our mission is to continuously improve our systems, processes, and performance, ensuring compliance with the highest industry standards while meeting the needs of our clients. To strengthen our technical team and maintain the integrity of our operations, we are inviting qualified and experienced professionals to apply for the position of Reliability Monitoring Engineer . This role is designed for highly analytical individuals who are passionate about aviation safety, reliability engineering, and continuous improvement. The successful candidate will play a key part in monitoring and improving the reliability, performance, and safety of our aircraft systems, ensuring they consistently operate as intended throughout their lifecycle. This is an exciting opportunity to join a company that values professionalism, innovation, and teamwork. If you are results-driven, detail-oriented, and eager to contribute to a dynamic aviation environment, then this role may be the perfect fit for you. Position: Reliability Monitoring Engineer Overview The Reliability Monitoring Engineer is responsible for analysing and improving the reliability, performance, and safety of aircraft systems. By identifying trends, conducting in-depth data analysis, and recommending corrective actions, the role ensures that airworthiness is maintained, regulatory requirements are met, and aircraft systems continue to perform efficiently throughout their operational life. This is a critical role within our organisation, as it directly contributes to operational reliability, customer satisfaction, and cost efficiency. Key Accountabilities As a Reliability Monitoring Engineer, your responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following: Reliability Program Development : Develop comprehensive reliability program plans, perform detailed reliability analysis, and apportion failure rates to different systems and subsystems. Prepare reliability predictions, reports, and improvement recommendations. Procedures and Standards : Develop and maintain work instructions and procedures for the reliability section to ensure standardisation and compliance with both company and regulatory requirements. Safety and Hazard Analysis : Perform system and subsystem safety hazard analyses, assign hazard ratings, and propose effective mitigation strategies. Ensure hazards are tracked and managed to acceptable levels of risk. Defect Monitoring and Documentation : Maintain and update a repetitive defect database. Review strip records from manufacturers and vendors, generate historical reports, and benchmark findings against industry standards. Deferred Defects Management : Monitor and control acceptable deferred defects ADDS, ensuring accuracy and timely resolution to reduce costs associated with dispensations by the industry regulator KCAA. Root Cause Analysis : Conduct defect, delay, and event investigations to establish root causes and recommend corrective or preventive actions for conditions that exceed alert limits. End-of-Life Part Management : Research, evaluate, and approve alternate sources for replacing End-of-Life EOL parts to sustain operational efficiency. Technical Support : Provide technical expertise and support to the maintenance team, ensuring safe, effective, and cost-efficient operations. Reporting : Prepare and submit Component Failure Reports, Non-incident statements, and other technical documentation required by regulators and management. Continuous Improvement : Develop and refine standard analysis methods and processes to enhance component reliability. Submit recommendations focused on safety, reliability, and cost control. Data Management : Maintain a database of potential reliability and operational efficiency initiatives, track implementation progress, and ensure accountability. Safety and Compliance : Report hazards, near misses, and incidents in accordance with company procedures. Promote a safe and secure work environment that aligns with company, regulatory, and legislative requirements. Environmental Stewardship : Support the implementation of the Environmental Management System EMS within your department and the wider organisation. Other Duties : Undertake any additional responsibilities as assigned to support the smooth operation of the department and the company. Education and Experience Requirements To be considered for this position, applicants must meet the following criteria: Education Bachelors Degree in Aeronautical Engineering or equivalent from a recognised institution. KCSE Mean grade of C or higher, with at least a C in Mathematics, Physics, and English. Proficiency in office software and computer applications. Knowledge of data analysis is advantageous. Familiarity with Power BI is an added advantage. Demonstrated knowledge of KCAA regulations and reliability engineering concepts. Experience At least 3 years of proven experience in a reliability department. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel. Ability to deliver technical and business briefings to internal and external stakeholders. Strong decision-making skills with the ability to evaluate risks and implement timely solutions. Demonstrated commitment to safety, compliance, and operational excellence. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively across diverse teams and locations. Exceptional organisational and problem-solving skills, with the ability to manage workload priorities under pressure. A calm and professional approach when handling high-pressure situations. Highly motivated, results-oriented, and committed to teamwork. Strong analytical skills with keen attention to detail. Dedication to company values, particularly Doing it Right the First Time. Openness to continuous learning, adaptability, and the ability to grasp new concepts quickly. Training in Safety Management Systems SMS and Environmental Management Systems EMS will be considered an added advantage. Why Join Seven Four Eight Air Services K Limited? Reputation and Legacy : As one of Kenyas established air service providers, we have a long-standing reputation for reliability and excellence. Commitment to Safety : Safety is at the heart of everything we do, and as part of our team, you will contribute to maintaining the highest airworthiness standards. Growth and Learning : We believe in continuous professional development and provide opportunities for employees to learn, innovate, and grow. Team Spirit : Work alongside skilled professionals who value teamwork, collaboration, and knowledge sharing. Impact : This role provides a chance to directly influence operational efficiency, cost control, and overall reliabilitykey drivers of our success in the aviation industry. How to Apply If you are passionate about aviation reliability and meet the requirements above, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Your application should include the following: A letter of application. A recent CV with at least three referees include their mobile numbers and email addresses. Copies of academic certificates. Copies of professional certificates. Please send your application to: Email : careers.hr748airservices.com Subject Line : VAC 11 2025  RELIABILITY MONITORING ENGINEER Closing Date : 30th September 2025, midnight. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Important Notes Seven Four Eight Air Services K Limited is an equal opportunity employer. A background check may be conducted before or during employment. Employment is subject to successful completion of a medical check-up to ascertain fitness for duty. Employment will only commence upon acceptance of the official Letter of Offer. This is your opportunity to join a forward-thinking company dedicated to excellence in aviation. If you are ready to take on this challenge and contribute to the success of Seven Four Eight Air Services K Limited, we look forward to receiving your application. Apply Now

title: The Rainforest Alliance Hiring Junior Survey Engineer
description: 50 The Rainforest Alliance is an international non-profit organization working at the intersection of business, agriculture, and forests. With a mission to create a world where people and nature thrive in harmony, the Alliance promotes sustainable practices, builds strong collaborations, and drives forward innovative solutions to some of the most pressing environmental and social challenges. In Kenya, the organization continues to play a vital role in ensuring responsible practices that protect biodiversity while improving the livelihoods of farming and forest communities. To deliver on this mission, the Rainforest Alliance leverages technology, data, and innovation to strengthen accountability and efficiency in its global programs. As part of its commitment to digital transformation, the Technology department is spearheading the development and implementation of a strategic Digital Product Roadmap that supports global business initiatives and assurance programs. This involves creating, refining, and maintaining digital solutions that support field data collection, survey analysis, and reporting. To strengthen this work, the Rainforest Alliance is seeking a Junior Survey Engineer to join the Nairobi office. This role is a unique opportunity for an early-career professional passionate about technology, data, and sustainable development. The selected candidate will work at the heart of survey design, automation, and data integration while supporting the organizations efforts to make impactful, evidence-based decisions. Position: Junior Survey Engineer Location: Nairobi, Kenya Organization: Rainforest Alliance Posted On: September 22, 2025 Application Deadline: October 3, 2025 Level: 5 Position Summary The Junior Survey Engineer will support the design, development, and maintenance of digital survey tools and associated data pipelines. This includes working with platforms such as XLSForm and KoBoToolbox , developing automation scripts, building APIs, and ensuring survey data is efficiently integrated with internal and external systems. The role requires strong technical skills in Python programming, data manipulation, and API development, alongside effective collaboration and communication skills to work with diverse teams across the organization. This is an exciting position for a motivated and detail-oriented individual who thrives in problem-solving, values precision in data handling, and is eager to contribute to global initiatives that promote sustainability and inclusivity. Key Responsibilities As a Junior Survey Engineer, your role will cover several core areas of responsibility: 1. Data Integration Use Python to extract, transform, and load ETL survey data through APIs. Ensure seamless data flow between survey platforms, internal systems, and external partners. Maintain data consistency and reliability across digital products. 2. Automation Develop Python scripts that automate repetitive survey processes. Streamline data collection, cleaning, validation, and reporting workflows. Optimize data management to improve operational efficiency. 3. API Development Design, implement, and maintain APIs that facilitate smooth data exchange. Support the integration of survey tools with Rainforest Alliance platforms. Ensure APIs are secure, reliable, and scalable. 4. Data Schema Management Work with JSON and XML formats to define and validate data schemas. Maintain high standards of data quality and accuracy. Support schema updates to accommodate evolving survey requirements. 5. Quality Assurance Test survey forms to ensure accuracy, usability, and performance. Identify and resolve issues in data pipelines before deployment. Collaborate with stakeholders to continuously improve digital tools. 6. Collaboration and Support Work closely with field teams to design surveys that meet program needs. Provide technical guidance on the use of digital data collection tools. Partner with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot challenges and refine instruments. Requirements Technical Skills Basic experience in XLSForm and KoBoToolbox or similar platforms such as ODK or SurveyCTO. Proficiency in Python , with hands-on experience in: Data manipulation libraries e.g., Pandas, NumPy. Creating and consuming APIs e.g., REST, FastAPI. Working with JSON and XML data formats. Understanding of data schemas and validation methods. Familiarity with ExcelGoogle Sheets for analysis and reporting. Soft Skills Excellent time management and organizational abilities. Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking skills. Clear communication of technical concepts to diverse audiences. Ability to work collaboratively in multicultural and cross-functional teams. Education Degree or certification in Computer Science, Data Science, GIS, Survey Engineering , or a related field. Prior experience with digital survey tools and Python scripting will be considered an added advantage. Application Process Candidates will undergo a technical assessment as part of the recruitment process. This evaluation will measure proficiency in: .NET API development Cloud technologies DevOps practices Applicants should be legally authorized to work in Kenya. Diversity and Inclusion At the Rainforest Alliance, diversity, equity, and inclusion are not just valuesthey are integral to the mission. The organization is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or any other protected category. The Rainforest Alliance is committed to building a workplace where differences are valued, innovation thrives, and everyone can contribute their best. Notes Only candidates legally authorized to work in Kenya will be considered. Any questions regarding the vacancy may be directed to the HR department at recruitmentra.org . How to Apply If you are ready to bring your technical skills to an organization that is driving global sustainability, this is your opportunity. The Rainforest Alliance is looking for a dynamic Junior Survey Engineer to help transform the way data informs impact. Apply Now

title: Villa Rosa Kempinski Nairobi Hiring Engineering Trainee
description: 66 Villa Rosa Kempinski Nairobi, a five-star luxury hotel located on Chiromo Road, is pleased to announce an exciting internship opportunity within its Engineering Department. Known for its unmatched hospitality and world-class service, Villa Rosa Kempinski provides a dynamic working environment where passion meets professionalism. The hotel is conveniently situated just five minutes away from Nairobis city center and 20 km from Jomo Kenyatta International Airport. With 200 elegantly designed rooms and suites spread across 10 floors, five themed restaurants, state-of-the-art conference facilities, and the award-winning Kempinski The Spa, Villa Rosa Kempinski stands as a true symbol of luxury and excellence. title: Victory Farm Hiring Maintenance Engineer MarineSkipper
description: 49 The marine industry is a vital driver of global trade, innovation, and sustainable development. From maintaining high-performance vessels to navigating and leading ships across international waters, marine professionals are at the heart of ensuring that operations run safely, efficiently, and reliably. For individuals passionate about maritime engineering and leadership at sea, opportunities are now available to join a dynamic and growing organization. We are currently inviting applications for two critical positions in our marine operations: Maintenance Engineer Marine and Skipper . Both roles are integral to the smooth functioning of our fleet and require individuals who are committed, detail-oriented, and ready to contribute to advancing excellence within the industry. This article provides a detailed breakdown of each role, their key responsibilities, and what you can expect in terms of contribution, impact, and growth. If you are seeking a rewarding career in the maritime sector, this could be the perfect opportunity for you. Position 1: Maintenance Engineer Marine The role of a Maintenance Engineer Marine is one of the most essential technical positions within the maritime industry. This role ensures that vessels remain in optimal operating condition through consistent monitoring, repairs, and preventive maintenance. As a Maintenance Engineer, you will play a key part in maintaining safety, reliability, and efficiency on board. Key Responsibilities: Routine Maintenance and Repairs Conduct preventive and corrective maintenance on marine machinery and equipment. Perform troubleshooting and diagnostic checks on mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic systems. Address technical issues promptly to minimize vessel downtime. Machinery and Systems Oversight Monitor and maintain the main engine, auxiliary engines, propulsion systems, pumps, and other critical equipment. Ensure that all machinery is operating in compliance with set performance standards. Maintain up-to-date records of servicing and repairs. Safety and Compliance Adhere to maritime safety regulations and ensure all equipment meets compliance standards. Implement safety procedures to minimize hazards during maintenance activities. Assist with inspections by classification societies and regulatory bodies. Operational Support Collaborate with the skipper and crew to ensure smooth vessel operation. Support operational readiness by ensuring machinery is always prepared for deployment. Provide technical expertise in case of emergencies at sea. Documentation and Reporting Maintain accurate logs of maintenance tasks, spare parts usage, and system performance. Prepare detailed technical reports for management and compliance purposes. Assist in planning maintenance schedules based on vessel activity. Why This Role Matters Without proper maintenance, vessels are vulnerable to mechanical failure, inefficiency, and safety risks. The Maintenance Engineer ensures operational reliability, reduces downtime, and upholds the vessels performance. This role is not just about technical abilityits about safeguarding the backbone of marine operations. Position 2: Skipper The Skipper is the leader of a vessel, responsible for navigation, safety, and overall crew management. This position demands exceptional leadership, decision-making, and knowledge of maritime navigation and safety protocols. As a skipper, you will be entrusted with ensuring that voyages are conducted safely and efficiently while leading the crew with authority and care. Key Responsibilities: Navigation and Voyage Planning Chart courses using up-to-date navigational tools and technology. Monitor weather conditions, tides, and currents to adjust routes as necessary. Ensure compliance with international and local maritime navigation regulations. Crew Leadership and Management Lead, guide, and supervise crew members to ensure smooth day-to-day operations. Allocate tasks based on crew strengths and operational priorities. Foster teamwork, discipline, and safety awareness among all on board. Safety and Compliance Maintain strict adherence to safety procedures and emergency protocols. Conduct regular safety drills, including fire, man-overboard, and evacuation exercises. Ensure the vessel complies with international maritime safety standards. Operational Oversight Oversee cargo loading, unloading, and storage to ensure balance and safety. Monitor fuel consumption and manage resources efficiently. Ensure communication systems on board are operational and reliable. Decision Making at Sea Make critical decisions during emergencies or challenging situations. Ensure that the welfare of the crew and vessel are prioritized at all times. Act as the main point of communication with port authorities, regulators, and management. Why This Role Matters A skipper is not only the captain of the vessel but also its anchor of leadership. This role carries immense responsibility for both the people and the assets on board. The skipper ensures that every voyage is completed successfully while upholding the highest standards of safety, discipline, and efficiency. Why Join Us? Joining our organization means becoming part of a team that values expertise, integrity, and innovation in the marine sector. We offer: A chance to work with highly skilled professionals in a challenging and rewarding environment. Opportunities to grow within the maritime industry through training and career development. A workplace culture that prioritizes safety, efficiency, and teamwork. Competitive terms aligned with industry standards. By joining us, you will be contributing to a mission that supports sustainable maritime operations while developing your professional skills in one of the most dynamic industries worldwide. How to Apply If you are interested in applying for the Maintenance Engineer Marine or Skipper positions, please refer to the attached PDF for more details on the application process, deadlines, and additional information about the roles. Apply Now

title: Seven Four Eight Air Services Hiring Reliability Monitoring Engineer
description: 50 Seven Four Eight Air Services K Limited, a leading aviation company committed to safety, operational excellence, and efficiency, is seeking to recruit a highly skilled and motivated professional to join its Technical Services Department . This opportunity is designed for a candidate who is passionate about aviation engineering, reliability management, and contributing to maintaining the highest standards of airworthiness. The position of Reliability Monitoring Engineer is a critical role in ensuring the safety, reliability, and performance of aircraft systems. The engineer will be tasked with developing and implementing reliability programs, analysing performance data, managing hazards, and providing technical support to enhance operational efficiency. This is a career-defining opportunity to contribute directly to a company that upholds safety, compliance, and continuous improvement as its core values. The successful candidate will not only ensure that the aircraft remain airworthy but will also drive initiatives to improve reliability, reduce costs, and maintain compliance with regulatory requirements such as those of the Kenya Civil Aviation Authority KCAA. Job Title: Reliability Monitoring Engineer Department: Technical Services Key Accountabilities The Reliability Monitoring Engineer will undertake a wide range of duties designed to enhance the safety, reliability, and efficiency of aircraft operations. Responsibilities will include: Reliability Program Development and Analysis Create and implement reliability program plans. Conduct reliability analysis, failure rate apportioning, and generate detailed reliability reports. Continuously assess data to identify opportunities for improvement. Procedures and Documentation Develop and maintain work instructions and section procedures. Document and maintain a repetitive defect database. Review strip records from manufacturersvendors and benchmark findings against industry standards. Safety and Hazard Management Perform system and subsystem safety hazard analyses. Assign hazard ratings, develop mitigation strategies, and ensure hazards are tracked to acceptable risk levels. Carry out defect and delay analyses, identifying root causes and recommending corrective actions. Deferred Defects Management Monitor and control Acceptable Deferred Defects ADDS for accuracy and compliance. Ensure minimisation of costs associated with dispensations from KCAA. Technical Support Provide guidance and technical expertise to the maintenance team. Initiate investigations for issues exceeding alert limits and recommend preventive actions. Research and approve alternate sources for End-of-Life EOL parts. Component Reliability Management Establish component repair and build specifications. Enhance dispatch reliability while ensuring compliance with budgetary and regulatory requirements. Prepare and submit Component Failure Reports and Non-Incident Statements. Continuous Improvement Refine standard analysis methods and processes. Submit recommendations focusing on safety, reliability, and cost control. Track accountability for reliability and operational efficiency initiatives. Regulatory and Environmental Compliance Ensure strict compliance with KCAA regulations and industry standards. Support the implementation of the Environmental Management System EMS. Report hazards, near misses, and incidents as per company procedures. Workplace Safety Promote and maintain a healthy, safe, and secure working environment. Comply with legislative and company requirements for occupational safety and health. Education Requirements Applicants must meet the following academic qualifications: Bachelors Degree in Aeronautical Engineering or equivalent from a recognised institution. KCSE Mean Score of C with at least C in Mathematics, Physics, and English. Proficiency in office software and computer applications. Knowledge of data analysis Power BI knowledge is an added advantage. Familiarity with KCAA regulations and reliability concepts. Experience Requirements Candidates must have proven practical experience in aviation reliability. Specifically: At least 3 years experience in a reliability department. Advanced proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel. Strong presentation skills for business and technical briefings. Risk evaluation and decision-making skills, with a commitment to safety. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to collaborate in a cross-functional and multi-location environment. Strong conflict resolution skills and professional demeanour under pressure. Organisational and problem-solving skills, with the ability to prioritise. Demonstrated results-oriented mindset, high motivation, and strong teamwork ethic. Analytical ability and attention to detail. Commitment to company values and continuous learning. Knowledge and training in Safety Management Systems SMS and Environmental Management Systems EMS is an added advantage. Why Join Seven Four Eight Air Services? By joining Seven Four Eight Air Services, you will be part of a company that is deeply committed to: Upholding the highest standards of safety and reliability . Providing opportunities for professional growth and development . Encouraging innovation in technical services and reliability engineering. Offering a collaborative work environment that values teamwork and excellence. Application Requirements Applicants are required to submit the following documents: A letter of application. A recent CV, including at least three referees with mobile numbers and email addresses. Copies of academic certificates. Copies of professional certificates. How to Apply Send your complete application package to: Email: careers.hr748airservices.com Subject Line: VAC 11 2025  RELIABILITY MONITORING ENGINEER The closing date for applications is September 30, 2025, at midnight . Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Important Notes Seven Four Eight Air Services K Limited is an equal opportunity employer . A background check may be conducted before confirmation of employment or anytime during employment. Employment is subject to satisfactory completion of a medical check-up . Employment with Seven Four Eight Air Services K Limited will commence only upon acceptance of the Letter of Offer . This is an excellent opportunity for aviation professionals seeking to make a significant impact in a highly technical and safety-focused environment. If you meet the requirements and are passionate about contributing to aviation excellence, this role is tailored for you. Apply now and take your career to new heights with Seven Four Eight Air Services K Limited. Apply Now
