title: Judicial Service Commission
description: 7 An opportunity has arisen for suitably qualified and experienced individuals to apply for several senior and strategic positions within a public institution operating at the national level. These vacancies span leadership, judicial, policy, administrative, and information and communication technology functions. The institution seeks to attract competent professionals who can contribute to the effective delivery of constitutional mandates, institutional governance, policy development, judicial administration, and secure technology operations. The advertised positions are offered under varying employment terms, including contract and permanent and pensionable arrangements, depending on the role. Each position plays a critical role in supporting institutional objectives, service delivery, and public accountability. Interested candidates are encouraged to review the details of each vacancy carefully, including job reference numbers, employment terms, and closing dates, before submitting their applications. All applications must be submitted on or before the respective closing dates indicated for each position. Deputy Director, Research and Policy Job Reference No: VNO. 112026 Vacancy No: 1 Posted On: 27 January 2026 Closing Date: 16 February 2026 Employment Terms: Five-Year Contract Work Station: As Assigned Position Overview The Deputy Director, Research and Policy is a senior management role responsible for providing strategic leadership in research, policy analysis, and evidence-based decision-making. The position supports institutional leadership by ensuring that policies, strategies, and reforms are informed by high-quality research, data analysis, and stakeholder consultation. The role requires close collaboration with internal departments, external partners, government agencies, and policy institutions to strengthen research capacity and enhance the quality of policy outputs. Key Duties and Responsibilities The Deputy Director, Research and Policy will oversee the planning, coordination, and implementation of research initiatives aligned with institutional mandates and strategic objectives. This includes identifying priority research areas, developing research frameworks, and ensuring that studies address emerging policy issues. The role involves leading the formulation, review, and evaluation of policies, guidelines, and strategic papers. The position holder will ensure that policy proposals are supported by credible evidence, legal considerations, and socio-economic analysis. The officer will supervise research and policy staff, providing technical guidance, mentorship, and performance oversight. This includes setting work plans, monitoring progress, and ensuring timely delivery of outputs. The position entails coordinating policy dialogue forums, consultative meetings, and stakeholder engagements to gather input, disseminate findings, and promote policy coherence. The Deputy Director will also represent the institution in inter-agency committees, conferences, and policy platforms as required. Additional responsibilities include managing research budgets, overseeing data management systems, ensuring compliance with ethical research standards, and preparing reports for senior management and oversight bodies. Judge of the Supreme Court of Kenya Job Reference No: VNO. 12026 Vacancy No: 1 Posted On: 27 January 2026 Closing Date: 17 February 2026 Employment Terms: As Prescribed Work Station: Supreme Court of Kenya Position Overview The Judge of the Supreme Court of Kenya holds one of the highest judicial offices in the country. The position is central to the interpretation and application of the Constitution, development of jurisprudence, and determination of matters of national importance. The role carries significant responsibility in safeguarding the rule of law, ensuring access to justice, and upholding constitutional values and principles. Key Duties and Responsibilities The Judge will hear and determine cases and appeals brought before the Supreme Court, including constitutional petitions, presidential election disputes, and advisory opinions. The role involves interpreting the Constitution, statutes, and legal principles, and delivering reasoned judgments and rulings that contribute to the development of Kenyan jurisprudence. The Judge will participate in judicial conferences, deliberations, and decision-making processes of the Supreme Court, contributing to collective judgments and institutional governance. The position includes oversight of judicial processes to ensure fairness, impartiality, and adherence to due process. The Judge will also contribute to the development of practice directions and procedural rules where required. Additional duties include mentoring judicial officers, participating in judicial training initiatives, and representing the judiciary in national, regional, or international forums as appropriate. Assistant Director, ICT Infrastructure Job Reference No: VNO. 52026 Vacancy No: 1 Posted On: 16 January 2026 Closing Date: 5 February 2026 Employment Terms: Permanent and Pensionable Work Station: As Assigned Position Overview The Assistant Director, ICT Infrastructure is responsible for the planning, implementation, and management of the institutions ICT infrastructure. This includes networks, servers, data centres, hardware systems, and related platforms that support operational continuity and service delivery. The role ensures that ICT infrastructure is reliable, scalable, and aligned with institutional needs and technological advancements. Key Duties and Responsibilities The Assistant Director will oversee the design, deployment, and maintenance of ICT infrastructure, ensuring optimal performance, availability, and resilience of systems. The role involves managing network architecture, server environments, storage solutions, and connectivity across multiple locations. The officer will ensure that infrastructure supports both current operations and future growth. The position includes supervising ICT technical teams, assigning duties, monitoring performance, and providing leadership in infrastructure projects and upgrades. The officer will develop and implement infrastructure standards, policies, and procedures, ensuring compliance with best practices and regulatory requirements. Additional responsibilities include coordinating procurement and installation of ICT equipment, managing vendor relationships, monitoring service-level agreements, and preparing technical reports for management. Assistant Director, ICT Security Job Reference No: VNO. 42026 Vacancy No: 1 Posted On: 16 January 2026 Closing Date: 5 February 2026 Employment Terms: Permanent and Pensionable Work Station: As Assigned Position Overview The Assistant Director, ICT Security is tasked with safeguarding the institutions information systems, data, and digital assets. The role focuses on developing and enforcing cybersecurity measures to protect against threats, vulnerabilities, and breaches. The position plays a critical role in ensuring confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information systems. Key Duties and Responsibilities The Assistant Director will develop and implement ICT security policies, frameworks, and controls to mitigate cyber risks and ensure compliance with applicable standards. The role involves monitoring systems for security incidents, coordinating response measures, and conducting investigations into breaches or attempted intrusions. The officer will oversee vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, and risk assessments, recommending corrective actions where necessary. The position includes providing security awareness and guidance to staff, promoting best practices in information security and data protection. Additional duties include managing security tools and technologies, coordinating with external security agencies or consultants, and preparing security reports and advisories for senior management. Registrar, Judicial Service Commission Job Reference No: VNO. 32026 Vacancy No: 1 Posted On: 16 January 2026 Closing Date: 5 February 2026 Employment Terms: Contract Work Station: As Assigned Position Overview The Registrar, Judicial Service Commission serves as the chief executive and accounting officer of the Commission. The role is responsible for the overall administration, management, and coordination of the Commissions functions in accordance with constitutional and statutory provisions. The position supports the Commission in executing its mandate relating to judicial appointments, discipline, governance, and oversight. Key Duties and Responsibilities The Registrar will coordinate the implementation of decisions and resolutions of the Judicial Service Commission, ensuring timely and effective execution. The role involves managing the Commissions secretariat, overseeing human resources, finance, procurement, and administrative functions. The position includes advising the Commission on legal, policy, and procedural matters, and ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations. The Registrar will prepare reports, briefs, and documentation for Commission meetings, parliamentary engagements, and other oversight processes. Additional responsibilities include managing stakeholder relations, representing the Commission in official forums, and ensuring proper records management and accountability mechanisms. Chief Kadhi Job Reference No: VNO. 22026 Vacancy No: 1 Posted On: 16 January 2026 Closing Date: 5 February 2026 Employment Terms: Permanent and Pensionable Work Station: As Assigned Position Overview The Chief Kadhi is the head of the Kadhis Courts and is responsible for overseeing the administration of justice in matters of personal law affecting persons who profess the Islamic faith. The role provides leadership, guidance, and supervision within the Kadhis Court system. The position is central to ensuring consistency, integrity, and effectiveness in the adjudication of matters under Islamic law as recognized by the Constitution. Key Duties and Responsibilities The Chief Kadhi will preside over cases within the jurisdiction of the Kadhis Courts, hearing and determining matters relating to marriage, divorce, inheritance, and personal status. The role involves supervising and providing guidance to other Kadhis, ensuring uniform application of the law and adherence to judicial standards. The position includes administrative oversight of the Kadhis Courts, including case management, allocation of duties, and coordination with judicial administration structures. The Chief Kadhi will advise judicial authorities on matters relating to Islamic law and practice and may participate in judicial committees or reform initiatives as required. Additional duties include representing the Kadhis Courts in official functions, promoting access to justice, and ensuring ethical conduct within the court system. Application Process Interested candidates are invited to submit their applications for the above positions in accordance with the instructions provided by the recruiting institution. Applicants should ensure that they clearly indicate the position applied for, including the relevant job reference number, and submit all required information before the respective closing dates. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Apply Now

description: 7 A public sector institution is undertaking a large-scale recruitment exercise to strengthen its operational, regulatory, administrative, and technical capacity. The organisation is seeking to fill a wide range of permanent positions across multiple departments, including supply chain management, records management, security, administration, customer service, corporate communication, human resource management, finance, information and communication technology, legal services, cybersecurity, conduct supervision, anti-money laundering supervision, and general supervision functions. The available roles span entry-level, mid-level, senior, and principal positions, as well as assistant director roles. This recruitment drive is intended to enhance service delivery, governance, compliance, and oversight functions in line with the institutions statutory mandate. All positions are offered on permanent terms and are suitable for professionals seeking long-term career progression within a structured and regulated environment. The following sections provide detailed job descriptions for each advertised position. The information is presented in a clear and neutral manner to support suitability for a third-party job board and to allow prospective applicants to fully understand the scope of responsibilities associated with each role. Positions and Detailed Job Descriptions Principal Supply Chain Management Officer  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Principal Supply Chain Management Officer will be responsible for providing strategic leadership and oversight of supply chain operations within the organisation. The role involves planning, coordinating, and supervising procurement, logistics, inventory management, and contract administration activities to ensure efficiency, transparency, and compliance with applicable policies and regulations. Key duties include developing and implementing supply chain strategies, overseeing procurement planning and execution, managing supplier relationships, monitoring contract performance, and ensuring value for money in all procurement activities. The officer will also provide guidance to junior supply chain staff, prepare reports for management, and contribute to continuous improvement of supply chain systems and processes. Records Assistant II  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Records Assistant II will support the management of physical and electronic records in accordance with established records management policies and procedures. The role involves filing, indexing, retrieval, and safe custody of organisational records. Responsibilities include maintaining accurate and up-to-date records, assisting in classification and archiving of documents, supporting records audits, and ensuring confidentiality and integrity of information. The position also involves responding to internal requests for records and supporting the disposal of records in line with approved schedules. Records Assistant I  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Records Assistant I will provide basic records management support under supervision. The role focuses on routine filing, document tracking, and retrieval tasks. Duties include organizing files, updating records registers, assisting in digitisation initiatives, and ensuring records are stored correctly. The officer will also support senior records staff in maintaining order and accessibility of records across departments. Security Officer  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Security Officer will be responsible for maintaining the safety and security of organisational premises, staff, visitors, and assets. The role involves monitoring access points, conducting patrols, and enforcing security procedures. Key responsibilities include controlling entry and exit, responding to security incidents, reporting breaches, and ensuring compliance with security protocols. The officer will also assist in emergency response situations and support the implementation of security risk mitigation measures. Principal Administration Officer  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Principal Administration Officer will oversee administrative functions and provide leadership in office management, logistics, and general support services. The role involves coordinating administrative operations to ensure efficient service delivery. Duties include supervising administrative staff, managing office resources, coordinating meetings and official events, overseeing fleet and facilities management, and preparing administrative reports. The officer will also contribute to policy development and implementation within the administration function. Customer Care Assistant III  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Customer Care Assistant III will provide frontline customer service support. The role involves handling routine inquiries, providing information, and assisting clients in accessing services. Responsibilities include responding to walk-in, telephone, and written inquiries, recording customer feedback, escalating issues where necessary, and maintaining accurate customer service records. The role supports the delivery of consistent and professional customer experiences. Customer Care Assistant II  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Customer Care Assistant II will handle a wider range of customer service issues and provide support to junior customer care staff. The role involves resolving customer complaints, providing detailed information, and ensuring service standards are met. Duties include managing customer interactions, maintaining service logs, contributing to service improvement initiatives, and supporting customer satisfaction monitoring activities. Customer Care Assistant I  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Customer Care Assistant I will undertake entry-level customer service duties under supervision. The role focuses on assisting customers with basic inquiries and directing them to appropriate services or officers. Responsibilities include greeting clients, responding to general inquiries, maintaining customer records, and supporting customer care operations. Senior Customer Care Assistant  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Senior Customer Care Assistant will supervise customer care operations and provide leadership within the customer service function. The role involves managing service delivery, handling complex customer issues, and mentoring customer care staff. Key duties include monitoring service quality, preparing customer service reports, coordinating customer feedback mechanisms, and contributing to policy and procedure development within the customer care unit. Corporate Communication and Public Relations Officer  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Corporate Communication and Public Relations Officer will manage internal and external communication activities. The role involves developing communication materials, managing media relations, and supporting public engagement initiatives. Responsibilities include drafting press releases, coordinating corporate events, managing digital communication platforms, and ensuring consistent organisational messaging. The officer will also monitor media coverage and support crisis communication efforts. Senior Corporate Communication and Public Relations Officer  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Senior Corporate Communication and Public Relations Officer will provide strategic leadership in corporate communication and public relations. The role involves planning and overseeing communication strategies that support organisational objectives. Duties include supervising communication staff, managing high-level media engagements, advising management on communication matters, and evaluating the effectiveness of communication initiatives. Assistant Director, Human Resource Management  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Assistant Director, Human Resource Management will support the formulation and implementation of human resource policies and strategies. The role involves overseeing HR operations, including staffing, performance management, and employee relations. Responsibilities include supervising HR staff, coordinating recruitment and selection processes, managing staff development initiatives, and ensuring compliance with labour laws and internal policies. Assistant Director, Finance  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Assistant Director, Finance will support financial management and oversight functions. The role involves budgeting, financial reporting, and ensuring effective financial controls. Key duties include coordinating budget preparation, monitoring expenditure, preparing financial statements, overseeing accounting operations, and supporting audits. The role also involves advising management on financial matters. Assistant Director, Information, Communication and Technology  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Assistant Director, Information, Communication and Technology will oversee ICT operations and strategy implementation. The role involves managing information systems, infrastructure, and technology projects. Responsibilities include supervising ICT staff, ensuring system availability and security, coordinating system upgrades, and supporting digital transformation initiatives. Legal Officer Legal Services  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Legal Officer Legal Services will provide legal advice and support on matters relating to the organisations operations. The role involves legal research, drafting legal documents, and supporting litigation and dispute resolution. Duties include reviewing contracts, advising on compliance issues, representing the organisation in legal matters as required, and maintaining legal records. Legal Officer, Governance and Regulatory Services  1 Post Job Type: Permanent The Legal Officer, Governance and Regulatory Services will support governance frameworks and regulatory compliance. The role involves advising on governance issues, regulatory interpretation, and policy development. Responsibilities include reviewing governance documents, supporting board and committee processes, and ensuring compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements. Senior Legal Officer Legal Services  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Senior Legal Officer Legal Services will provide advanced legal support and supervision within the legal services function. The role involves handling complex legal matters and mentoring junior legal staff. Duties include leading legal research, advising on high-risk legal issues, coordinating litigation strategies, and contributing to legal policy development. Conduct Supervision Officer  3 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Conduct Supervision Officer will support oversight of conduct standards within regulated entities. The role involves monitoring compliance, conducting reviews, and identifying conduct risks. Responsibilities include analysing reports, conducting inspections, preparing supervision findings, and supporting enforcement actions where necessary. Cybersecurity Officer  4 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Cybersecurity Officer will support the protection of information systems and data. The role involves monitoring security threats, implementing controls, and responding to incidents. Duties include conducting risk assessments, monitoring system logs, supporting incident response, and contributing to cybersecurity awareness initiatives. Senior Cybersecurity Officer  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Senior Cybersecurity Officer will provide advanced technical oversight of cybersecurity operations. The role involves leading security initiatives and supervising cybersecurity staff. Responsibilities include developing security strategies, coordinating incident response, conducting advanced threat analysis, and advising management on cybersecurity risks. Principal Cybersecurity Officer  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Principal Cybersecurity Officer will provide strategic leadership in cybersecurity supervision and governance. The role involves policy development, oversight of security frameworks, and coordination with external stakeholders. Duties include setting cybersecurity standards, overseeing implementation of controls, and reporting on cybersecurity posture to senior management. Assistant Director, Cybersecurity Supervision  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Assistant Director, Cybersecurity Supervision will oversee cybersecurity supervision activities. The role involves managing teams responsible for assessing and monitoring cybersecurity compliance. Responsibilities include supervising staff, coordinating inspections, developing supervision methodologies, and contributing to regulatory policy development. Supervision Officer AML  4 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Supervision Officer AML will support anti-money laundering supervision activities. The role involves monitoring compliance with AML requirements and conducting supervisory reviews. Duties include analysing AML reports, conducting inspections, identifying compliance gaps, and preparing supervision reports. Senior Supervision Officer AML  3 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Senior Supervision Officer AML will provide leadership within AML supervision teams. The role involves handling complex AML supervision cases and mentoring junior officers. Responsibilities include coordinating inspections, reviewing supervision findings, and advising on AML risk mitigation strategies. Principal Supervision Officer AML  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Principal Supervision Officer AML will provide strategic oversight of AML supervision functions. The role involves policy development, high-level risk assessment, and coordination of AML initiatives. Duties include leading AML supervision programs, engaging with stakeholders, and reporting on AML risks and compliance trends. Supervision Officer  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Supervision Officer will support general supervision activities. The role involves monitoring compliance, conducting reviews, and supporting enforcement actions. Responsibilities include analysing data, conducting inspections, preparing reports, and supporting supervisory decision-making. Principal Supervision Officer  2 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Principal Supervision Officer will provide senior leadership in supervision functions. The role involves overseeing supervision teams and contributing to strategic supervision planning. Duties include supervising staff, coordinating complex supervision cases, developing supervision frameworks, and advising management on supervision outcomes. Assistant Director, Supervision  3 Posts Job Type: Permanent The Assistant Director, Supervision will oversee supervision operations and strategy implementation. The role involves managing teams, coordinating supervision programs, and ensuring effective oversight. Responsibilities include setting supervision priorities, monitoring performance, preparing management reports, and contributing to policy and regulatory development. Conclusion This recruitment exercise offers an opportunity for professionals at various career levels to contribute to a structured and regulated public sector environment. The roles outlined above provide opportunities to support governance, compliance, service delivery, and organisational development through permanent employment. Apply Now

title: SBM Bank Hiring Fraud  Security Operations Analyst
description: 44 Job Purpose The overall responsibility of this role is to be responsible for detecting, preventing and monitoring fraudulent activities across various financial and digital platforms. This role is critical in minimizing fraud and physical security losses, maintaining regulatory compliance, and protecting both the Bank and its customers from risks related to fraud and physical security risks. Key Responsibilities Fraud Risk Management  40 Review and analyze alerts generated by FMS monitoring system for potential fraud in the bank and escalating high risk cases to the team leader. Monitor FRM system activities to generate daily, weekly andor monthly reports identifying trends andor potential fraud activities. Ensure efficient identification and monitoring of fraudulent transactions. Build network with internal and external stakeholders that includes law enforcement agencies, corporate investigators, audit firms, systems vendors among others Flag suspected fraudulent activity through restricting accounts or recall of funds. Contribute to the review of fraud risk assessments, scenario analysis and new product or change initiative assessments. Monitor and report system downtimes or service disruptions by initiating timely incident reports and coordinating with relevant teams to ensure prompt resolution and service restoration. Co-ordinating vendors support as per internal protocol. Physical Security Surveillance  Emergency Response  30 Real time monitoring of physical security surveillance systems; CCTV, access control, intruder alarms and fire alarms for SBM Bank premises. Extract and analyze CCTV footage and access control system logs to reconstruct incidents, identify security breaches, and compile comprehensive investigative reports to support decision-making and incident resolution. Respond to emergencies including fire, intrusion or suspicious activities and coordinate with internal teams and emergency services. Receive, record and escalate incidents related to security, safety, or operations in line with Bank procedures. Recording and Documentation: Accurately record and document all incidents, suspicious activities, and system malfunctions in a clear, concise, and timely manner, adhering to the banks record-keeping policies. This may involve creating incident reports with relevant details and timestamps Coordinate the end-to-end payment processing workflow by generating invoices on E-citizen, ensuring accurate completion, submitting to branches for approval, and uploading finalized documents for submission to Accounts Payables for processing. Monitor and report system downtimes or service disruptions by initiating timely incident reports and coordinating with relevant teams to ensure prompt resolution and service restoration. User management of access control systems; biometric, card, alarm and preauthorization of vendors to strategic business locations as per internal protocols Reporting and Documentation  20 Regularly update the Blacklist. Generate intelligent MIS reports daily, weekly, and monthly leveraging data analytics to identify emerging trends, anomalies, and potential fraudphysical security risks. Collaboration and Compliance  10 Represents the bank in KBA and other fraud management meetings and provide secretariat to the meetings when required. Ensure alignment with the relevant legislation and internal governance frameworks. Key Relationships Direct Reports to this Position  Outsourced Vendors Customers of this Position: Management and Staff Customers Security and Fraud ManagersInvestigators of Police Services, Directorate of Criminal Investigation, Central Bank of Kenya, Capital Markets Authority, Insurance Regulatory Authority, Commercial Banks and any other institutions as may be required during investigation. Knowledge, Skills and Experience required for this Role University degree in any of the following specializations: Criminology, Actuarial, Finance, Law, Information Technology. The ability to identify, assess, monitor, control and mitigate fraud risks i.e. excellent analytical skills Proficiency in data analytics tools e.g., Excel, SQL, SAS and fraud detection systems. The ability to carry out data analysis on large data sets will be an added advantage. Proficiency in monitoring surveillance systems. Strong communication and report writing skills. High ethical standards and ability to handle confidential information. Ability to work under pressure in potentially uncomfortable situations. Competencies required for this Role Analytical thinking and attention to detail Team collaboration and stakeholder engagement Adhering to principles and values Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines Presenting and communicating information Writing and reporting Applying expertise and technology Persuading and influencing Knowledge of Kenyan banking regulations and fraud typologies Apply

title: Equity Bank Need Cyber Security Technical Programs Analyst
description: 55 Cyber Security Technical Programs Analyst    Description Job Purpose A Cyber Security Technical Program Analyst Security Technical Program Analyst plays a critical role in aligning security initiatives with business objectives, ensuring smooth project execution, and maintaining risk mitigation strategies. The role involves analyzing, managing and reporting cybersecurity programs and projects designed to protect Equity Groups assets, data, and systems from cyber threats. The Analyst will be part of the Group Information Security team and work closely with project teams to deliver cutting-edge, user friendly cyber security solutions to Equity Group. Below is a breakdown of key roles and responsibility involved in coordinating security project deployment and strategy execution: Responsibilities  Supporting Group CISO in providing business analysis, project  program implementation in the pursuit and delivery of cyber security projects and initiatives across Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, South Sudan, Rwanda  DRC, to achieve target maturity.  Manage and oversee key projects and initiatives, ensuring effective planning, coordination, and resource utilization to meet objectives and milestones.  Supervise the Program Management Function, ensuring projects are delivered end-to-end, managing inter-dependencies, and holding stakeholders accountable.  Identify and mitigate risks and issues to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery aligned with business objectives.  Monitor and report progress, ensuring stakeholders are informed and engaged.  Coordinate cross-functional teams security engineers, IT, DevOps and business units to ensure alignment.  Manage timelines, milestones, and deliverables while mitigating risks and dependencies.  Track deployment progress, ensuring security controls are implemented as designed. Cyber Security Strategy analysis, Reporting  Prioritization  Create and maintain a framework and strategy for managing the delivery of the Key projects and initiatives.  Lead planning and management of domain initiatives and activities.  Prepare reports and dashboard on cybersecurity strategy, program status and postures.  Analyze cybersecurity maturity assessment reports and track strategic initiatives that will achieve target maturity.  Collaborate with the project team and extended enterprise stakeholders to align cyber security initiatives with business objectives.  Translate security initiatives, policies and frameworks e.g., NIST, ISO 27001 into actionable tasks and programs.  Align security initiatives with business goals e.g., cloud migration, Zero Trust adoption.  Monitor regulatory compliance and ensure projects meet requirements Program Planning and Management  Manage program and project teams for optimal return-on-investment, and coordinate and delegate cross-project initiatives. title: SBM Hiring Fraud  Security Operations Analyst
description: 49 Job Purpose The overall responsibility of this role is to be responsible for detecting, preventing and monitoring fraudulent activities across various financial and digital platforms. This role is critical in minimizing fraud and physical security losses, maintaining regulatory compliance, and protecting both the Bank and its customers from risks related to fraud and physical security risks. Key Responsibilities Fraud Risk Management  40 Review and analyze alerts generated by FMS monitoring system for potential fraud in the bank and escalating high risk cases to the team leader. Monitor FRM system activities to generate daily, weekly andor monthly reports identifying trends andor potential fraud activities. Ensure efficient identification and monitoring of fraudulent transactions. Build network with internal and external stakeholders that includes law enforcement agencies, corporate investigators, audit firms, systems vendors among others Flag suspected fraudulent activity through restricting accounts or recall of funds. Contribute to the review of fraud risk assessments, scenario analysis and new product or change initiative assessments. Monitor and report system downtimes or service disruptions by initiating timely incident reports and coordinating with relevant teams to ensure prompt resolution and service restoration. Co-ordinating vendors support as per internal protocol. Physical Security Surveillance  Emergency Response  30 Real time monitoring of physical security surveillance systems; CCTV, access control, intruder alarms and fire alarms for SBM Bank premises. Extract and analyze CCTV footage and access control system logs to reconstruct incidents, identify security breaches, and compile comprehensive investigative reports to support decision-making and incident resolution. Respond to emergencies including fire, intrusion or suspicious activities and coordinate with internal teams and emergency services. Receive, record and escalate incidents related to security, safety, or operations in line with Bank procedures. Recording and Documentation: Accurately record and document all incidents, suspicious activities, and system malfunctions in a clear, concise, and timely manner, adhering to the banks record-keeping policies. This may involve creating incident reports with relevant details and timestamps Coordinate the end-to-end payment processing workflow by generating invoices on E-citizen, ensuring accurate completion, submitting to branches for approval, and uploading finalized documents for submission to Accounts Payables for processing. Monitor and report system downtimes or service disruptions by initiating timely incident reports and coordinating with relevant teams to ensure prompt resolution and service restoration. User management of access control systems; biometric, card, alarm and preauthorization of vendors to strategic business locations as per internal protocols Reporting and Documentation  20 Regularly update the Blacklist. Generate intelligent MIS reports daily, weekly, and monthly leveraging data analytics to identify emerging trends, anomalies, and potential fraudphysical security risks. Collaboration and Compliance  10 Represents the bank in KBA and other fraud management meetings and provide secretariat to the meetings when required. Ensure alignment with the relevant legislation and internal governance frameworks. Key Relationships Direct Reports to this Position  Outsourced Vendors Customers of this Position: Management and Staff Customers Security and Fraud ManagersInvestigators of Police Services, Directorate of Criminal Investigation, Central Bank of Kenya, Capital Markets Authority, Insurance Regulatory Authority, Commercial Banks and any other institutions as may be required during investigation. Knowledge, Skills and Experience required for this Role University degree in any of the following specializations: Criminology, Actuarial, Finance, Law, Information Technology. The ability to identify, assess, monitor, control and mitigate fraud risks i.e. excellent analytical skills Proficiency in data analytics tools e.g., Excel, SQL, SAS and fraud detection systems. The ability to carry out data analysis on large data sets will be an added advantage. Proficiency in monitoring surveillance systems. Strong communication and report writing skills. High ethical standards and ability to handle confidential information. Ability to work under pressure in potentially uncomfortable situations. Competencies required for this Role Analytical thinking and attention to detail Team collaboration and stakeholder engagement Adhering to principles and values Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines Presenting and communicating information Writing and reporting Applying expertise and technology Persuading and influencing Knowledge of Kenyan banking regulations and fraud typologies Department Risk BandLevel SeniorOfficer Location Head Office Contract Terms OpenEnded Length of Contract Open Ended Expiry Date Nov 03 2025 Apply Now

title: Equity Bank Hiring Cloud Security Assurance Analyst
description: 48 Cloud Security Assurance Analyst    Description Job Purpose: The Cloud Security Assurance Analyst will be responsible for providing oversight, assurance, and governance of the banks cloud security architecture. This role focuses on reviewing, validating, and assuring that security designs, controls, and implementations within Equitys cloud environments meet regulatory requirements, industry best practices, and the banks internal security standards. Key emphasis will be on evaluating proposed solutions, identifying risks, recommending improvements, and providing independent assurance that cloud deployments and services safeguard the banks assets and customer data. The Cloud Security Assurance Analyst will work closely with development, operations, and security teams to ensure the cloud infrastructure and applications are secure, compliant, and resilient against modern threats. Job Responsibilities Accountabilities: Cloud Governance and Technical Assurance: Provide governance and technical assurance over the security architecture of cloud platforms Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, Azure, Huawei Cloud Platform, ensuring that proposed and implemented designs align with the enterprise security strategy, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices. Provide assurance and oversight on the definition and effectiveness of security controls for cloud servicesincluding identity and access management IAM, encryption, key management, data protection, and network securityensuring they are properly designed, implemented, and aligned with enterprise security policies and regulatory requirements. Oversee and provide assurance on the establishment and maintenance of cloud security policies, standards, and procedures, ensuring they drive compliance with regulatory requirements e.g., GDPR, PCI-DSS, HIPAA and align with recognized security best practices. Conduct security assessments, vulnerability scans, and penetration testing to identify security risks in the cloud infrastructure. Provide recommendations for risk mitigation and security improvements. Lead efforts to harden cloud services and environments by configuring appropriate security settings, monitoring access controls, and enforcing security baselines. Provide oversight and technical assurance on the design and effectiveness of IAM frameworks, role-based access control RBAC, and multi-factor authentication MFA to ensure secure and compliant user and application access to cloud resources. Work with DevOps and development teams to integrate security into CICD pipelines and cloud-native application development DevSecOps. Implement automation to ensure security is maintained across cloud deployments. Collaborate with the Security Operations Center SOC and Incident Response teams to monitor, detect, and respond to cloud-specific security threats. Implement cloud-native security monitoring solutions if required. Ensure cloud environments comply with internal security policies and external regulatory standards. Work with compliance teams to implement audit controls and manage third-party audits of cloud infrastructure. Provide cloud security guidance and best practices to technical teams and ensure that secure coding, deployment, and management practices are followed. Advise on the security implications of migrating on-premises workloads to the cloud. Provide security guidance for hybrid and multi-cloud environments, ensuring consistency in security controls. Maintain documentation for cloud security architectures, configurations, and processes. Produce regular reports on cloud security posture and recommend actions for improvements. Qualifications Knowledge and Experience Education: A Degree in Computer Science, Information Security, Cybersecurity, or a related field Masters degree, an added advantage. Experience: Minimum of 4-6 years of hands-on experience in information security, with at least 2 years focused on cloud security. Proven experience designing and securing cloud-native services such as containers Docker, Kubernetes, serverless architectures AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, and microservices. Familiarity with cloud security frameworks and guidelines e.g., Cloud Well-Architected Framework, CIS Benchmarks, Cloud Security Alliance Cloud Control Matrix.  Experience with cloud-native security tools and services. Expertise in deploying and managing secure network architectures in cloud environments Azure, HCP, OCI. Knowledge of secure cloud networking VPCs, security groups, network peering and data protection practices.  Expertise in designing secure cloud infrastructure using Infrastructure-as-Code IaC tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, and Ansible. Deep understanding of cloud security controls, including identity and access management IAM, Data Encryption, Keys  Secrets Management, Firewalls, VPNs, and security groups. Certifications Preferred  Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge CCSK or Certified Cloud Security Professional CCSP  Certified Information Systems Security Professional CISSP Certified Information Security Manager CISM or Certified Information Systems Auditor CISA AWS Certified Security  Specialty or Microsoft Azure Security Architect or Microsoft Azure Security Engineer. Key Critical Competencies Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking abilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to translate technical security concepts into business-friendly language. Mentoring and teaching. Technology Awareness and Management. Organization : Equity Group Holdings

title: Sidian Bank Hiring Security Operations Centre Analyst SOC Analyst
description: 42 JOB PURPOSE The SOC Analyst will monitor, detect, and respond to cybersecurity threats across Sidian Banks infrastructure. Operating under ISO 27001, NIST, and CIS frameworks, they will analyze alerts, escalate incidents, and deliver timely reportsregardless of pressure. This role demands flexibility to work long shifts, including nights, weekends, and public holidays, ensuring 247 coverage and rapid incident containment. Responsibilities include threat hunting, refining detection rules, and coordinating with internal and external teams to strengthen SOC operations. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Security Monitoring  Incident Response 40: Continuously monitor Sidian Banks infrastructure using SIEM and other tools to detect, analyze, and respond to security incidents in real time. Ensure timely escalation and containment of threats. Threat Intelligence  Rule Tuning 20: Refine detection rules, validate log sources, and integrate threat intelligence feeds to improve alert accuracy and reduce false positives. Shift Operations  Coverage 20: Maintain 247 SOC coverage by working long shifts, including nights and weekends. Ensure seamless handovers and accurate documentation of incidents and actions taken. Reporting  Collaboration 20 : Generate incident reports and dashboards for internal stakeholders. Collaborate with IT, Risk, and external partners to support investigations and enhance SOC maturity. Main Activities Monitor and analyze security events across Sidian Bank systems to detect potential threats and anomalies in real time. Perform initial triage, threat validation, and escalation of incidents based on severity and impact. Conduct threat hunting activities to proactively identify indicators of compromise and emerging attack patterns. Coordinate incident response efforts, including containment, eradication, and recovery, in collaboration with IT and Risk teams. Maintain and tune SIEM detection rules, log sources, and alert thresholds to improve accuracy and reduce false positives. Generate timely and actionable incident reports for internal stakeholders, even under tight timelines. Work extended shifts, including nights and weekends, to ensure 247 SOC coverage and rapid response capability. Collaborate with system custodians to ensure remediation of identified risks and vulnerabilities within agreed timelines. Research emerging threats, attacker techniques, and defensive technologies to inform SOC strategy and tooling. Continuously review and improve SOC processes and playbooks to support agile threat response and operational efficiency. Technical Competencies Proficient in configuring and managing SIEM platforms for real-time event correlation, alerting, and incident triage across enterprise infrastructure. Skilled in firewall and web application protection technologies, including rule validation, traffic analysis, and threat mitigation. Experienced in endpoint protection and antimalware systems, supporting threat detection, containment, and response workflows. Working knowledge of cloud environments with emphasis on log ingestion, access monitoring, and cloud-native threat detection. Familiar with Agile-aligned SOC operations and DevSecOps toolchains used for incident tracking, automation, and continuous improvement. Strong analytical and reporting capabilities, enabling clear escalation paths and actionable insights for governance and risk teams. Understanding of financial services systems and regulatory expectations, ensuring SOC activities align with compliance and audit requirements. Experience in leading SOC shifts or mentoring junior analysts, promoting accountability, knowledge sharing, and operational resilience. Risk  Compliance: Attend training and maintain knowledge of and comply with all bank policies and procedures, including Anti Money LaunderingCountering Financing of TerrorismCountering Proliferation Financing laws, rules, and regulations. Participate or undertake Anti Money LaunderingCountering Financing of TerrorismCountering Proliferation Financing bank programs regularly, e.g., taking attestations, self-assessment tests, filling in compliance questionnaires as required. Comply and not to knowingly participate or assist in any violation of Anti Money LaunderingCountering Financing of TerrorismCountering Proliferation Financing laws, rules, regulations or internal policies, procedure and guidelines. Report suspected money laundering cases to their respective heads of units or to the Money Laundering Reporting Officer as soon as such incidents occur immediately with a clear basis of suspicion. Avoid Misrepresentation and Malicious Reporting  knowingly making a false, fictitious or fraudulent representation e.g. statement, report, document. Avoid Tipping Off customers being investigated so as not to knowingly prejudice an investigation by disclosing information. Not provide advice or other assistance to individuals who attempt to violate or avoid Anti Money LaunderingCountering Financing of TerrorismCountering Proliferation Financing laws, rules, regulations or corporate policies. Respond to all AMLCFTCPF queries when requested by Compliance Unit to allow the bank to comply with the requirements of The Anti-Money Laundering and Combating Financing of Terrorism Amendment Act. Co  operate fully with regulators and law enforcement agents and make available required documents and information. DECISION MAKING AUTHORITY Operational  Solution Design dependent on CRsBRDs assigned Strategic  Solution structuring to ensure ease of implementing future enhancements ACADEMIC BACKGROUND A Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. WORK EXPERIENCE Minimum of 3 years working experience in Information Systems Security, including areas such as ethical hacking, vulnerability assessments, ICT audits, and system implementation reviews. Minimum of 2 years working experience in networking and operating systems, with exposure to both proprietary and open-source platforms. Prior involvement in technical security assessments or audit support functions that enhance incident response and threat validation capabilities. Cross-functional understanding of infrastructure and system-level configurations, contributing to more effective log analysis and root cause investigations. SKILLS  COMPETENCIES Ability to use specialized tools and software to analyze, detect, investigate, and report on vulnerabilities and threats across enterprise environments. Knowledge and experience with key IT security products and controls, including event monitoring, data activity monitoring, endpoint protection, firewall management, and patch lifecycle oversight. Prior exposure to IT security operations within financial institutions, with an understanding of sector-specific risks and regulatory expectations. Keen attention to detail with a time-conscious approach, ensuring accuracy and responsiveness in high-stakes environments. Proven ability to perform under pressure in competitive and dynamic operational settings, maintaining composure and effectiveness during incident response and escalation. PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATION  ADDED ADVANTAGE ITIL Foundation Possess at least one security certification such as CEH Certified Ethical Hacker; SSCP Systems Security Certified Practitioner; OCSP Offensive Security Certified Professional; CompTIA Security Apply

title: HF Group Need Security Operations Centre Analyst
description: 57 Security Operations Centre Analyst HFC Limited, the banking and property finance subsidiary of HF Group, has an exciting opportunity in our ICT Department. We are seeking a talented, dynamic, self-driven, and results-oriented individual who is committed to performance, excellence, and participating in our growth strategy. The SOC Analysts role is to monitor, detect, and respond to security incidents across the companys IT infrastructure. The role holder is responsible for identifying and mitigating threats, analyzing security data, and ensuring the organizations network and data remain secure. Deadline: 2025-09-02 Category: ICT Subsidiary: HFC Principle Accountabilities Monitor and analyze security events and alerts generated by the companys security tools, such as SIEM Security Information and Event Management systems. Respond to and investigate security incidents, including malware infections, phishing attempts, unauthorized access, and other potential threats. Conduct in-depth analysis of security events to determine root causes and assess potential impacts. Collaborate with IT and other departments to resolve incidents and implement preventative measures. Perform vulnerability assessments and penetration testing to identify potential weaknesses in the network or systems. Stay updated on emerging security threats and recommend improvements to enhance the companys security posture. Create detailed reports on security incidents, trends, and mitigation strategies for management and technical teams. Ensure compliance with relevant security standards and regulations, such as GDPR, ISO 27001, and NIST. Participate in the development and enhancement of security policies, procedures, and best practices Key Competencies and Skills The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in cybersecurity, strong analytical skills, and familiarity with various security tools and protocols. General Competencies Minimum Qualifications, Knowledge and Experience Academic  Professional Bachelors degree in Cybersecurity, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field. Certifications such as CompTIA Security, CEH Certified Ethical Hacker, or CISSP are highly desirable. Experience Proven experience as a SOC Analyst or in a similar cybersecurity role. Strong understanding of network security, endpoint security, and threat detection techniques. Experience with security tools such as SIEM platforms Splunk, IBM QRadar, etc., firewalls, IDSIPS, and antivirus software. Familiarity with incident response, forensic analysis, and malware investigation. Knowledge of scripting and automation for security tasks Python, Bash, etc. is a plus. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with attention to detail. Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple security events simultaneously. Apply Now

title: Equity Bank Hiring Cyber Security Technical Programs Analyst
description: 97 Description A Cyber Security Technical Program Analyst Security Technical Program Analyst plays a critical role in aligning security initiatives with business objectives, ensuring smooth project execution, and maintaining risk mitigation strategies. The role involves analysing, managing and reporting cybersecurity programs and projects designed to protect Equity Groups assets, data, and systems from cyber threats. The Analyst will be part of the Group Information Security team and work closely with project teams to deliver cutting-edge, user friendly cyber security solutions to Equity Group. Below is a breakdown of key roles and responsibility involved in coordinating security project deployment and strategy execution: Job Purpose  Supporting Group CISO in providing business analysis, project  program implementation in the pursuit and delivery of cyber security projects and initiatives across Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, South Sudan, Rwanda  DRC, to achieve target maturity.  Manage and oversee key projects and initiatives, ensuring effective planning, coordination, and resource utilization to meet objectives and milestones.  Supervise the Program Management Function, ensuring projects are delivered end-to-end, managing inter-dependencies, and holding stakeholders accountable.  Identify and mitigate risks and issues to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery aligned with business objectives.  Monitor and report progress, ensuring stakeholders are informed and engaged.  Coordinate cross-functional teams security engineers, IT, DevOps and business units to ensure alignment.  Manage timelines, milestones, and deliverables while mitigating risks and dependencies.  Track deployment progress, ensuring security controls are implemented as designed. Cyber Security Strategy analysis, Reporting  Prioritization  Create and maintain a framework and strategy for managing the delivery of the Key projects and initiatives.  Lead planning and management of domain initiatives and activities.  Prepare reports and dashboard on cybersecurity strategy, program status and postures.  Analyze cybersecurity maturity assessment reports and track strategic initiatives that will achieve target maturity.  Collaborate with the project team and extended enterprise stakeholders to align cyber security initiatives with business objectives.  Translate security initiatives, policies and frameworks e.g., NIST, ISO 27001 into actionable tasks and programs.  Align security initiatives with business goals e.g., cloud migration, Zero Trust adoption.  Monitor regulatory compliance and ensure projects meet requirements Program Planning and Management  Manage program and project teams for optimal return-on-investment, and coordinate and delegate cross-project initiatives.  Ensure Project objectives align with strategic objectives and anticipated value creation are reflected in the scope.  Align Key Projects with overall Portfolio.  Ensure Project Governance and Project Management standards are compiled to by all projects.  Manage Program level Risks, Issues and Escalations and ensure mitigations are in place and action.  Ensure effective Stakeholder engagement and the establishment of an effective communication and reporting plan, for each project is in place.  Ensure Key Project roadmaps, project plans and milestones are updated, agreed and measured  Ensure the delivery of the Key Projects are within agreed quality, time and when needed according to cost.  Ensure strategic objectives of each Key project are measurable and met by tracking major milestones and status metrics of all projects within the portfolio.  Measure Key Project delivery performance and initiate proactive corrective actions as required to ensure delivery is within agreed targets.  Program scheduling of projects and initiatives  Manage delivery schedules for projects to ensure timeous implementation and compliance with requirements. Planning  Set objectives, assign tasks, and agree to timetables for achieving intermediate and overall goals.  Set review dates to ensure that projects remain on target .  Manage the portfolio roadmaps and portfolio plans are updated, agreed, measured and communicated as agreed with stakeholders Resource Management  Establish priorities within the overall program and ensure project teams are adequately resourced by aptly allocating people and technical resources to individual teams in line with those priorities.  Minimize waste and reduce costs by identifying tasks that are common to several projects and ensures that teams do not duplicate work.  Identify necessary skills available within the project teams and arrange any necessary training to improve performance.  Effective management of project and business teams from diverse areas of specialization. Risk Management  Work with stakeholders to identify risks, dependencies and opportunities across multiple projects.  Analyze, evaluate, and overcome program risks, and produce program reports for management and stakeholders.  To help project teams with difficult problems by contacting specialists within the organization to obtain information or request support.  Compile and communicate reports as agreed with stakeholders. Project Execution  Develop and execute comprehensive project plans, schedules, and budgets aligned with strategic objectives.  Oversee program progress, ensuring adherence to scope, timelines, milestones, deliverables, budget, and quality standards.  Collaborate with implementation partnersvendors to achieve program deliverables.  Document tangible and intangible benefits of projects.  Define and track project Key Performance Indicators KPIs.  Maintain and update benefit registers.  Monitor and communicate benefit realization post-project implementation. Business Analysis  Technical Specifications  Oversee requirements management processes including requirements elicitation, analysis, validation, and ongoing scope management.  Define, translate, and document business requirements of critical systems into technical specifications for robust ICT and cybersecurity solutions.  Collaborate with IT, technology projects and cybersecurity teams to ensure new solutions are secure and comply with national security and privacy policies  Manage and drive the approval of memos, business cases, checklists etc. Quality Assurance  Test Management Reviews test plans, monitors the testing process, serves as a liaison with Quality Assurance. Qualifications REQUIRED SKILLS Demonstrates the following leadership skills: Project Management Analysis AgileWaterfall, JIRA, Asana Security Frameworks NIST, CIS, ISO 27001 Risk Management  Compliance Cloud Security AWSAzureGCP Stakeholder Communication Qualifications University degree required. Minimum 3 years experience working with or managing technology solutions, preferably in the technologycybersecurity management function Implementation expertise with any enterprise or cloud-based technologycybersecurity management function Minimum 3 years experience working in a large, multinational organization Experience working on projects using Agile methodology a plus, but not required Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and adaptive to change Flexibility in working hours in order to work with diverse stakeholders Experience working with on prem and virtual project teams Proactive approach, ability to complete assigned project tasks with minimal guidance and supervision High level of qualityaccuracy in work Ability to work independently and remotely Excellent written and verbal communications skills required. Must be able to easily grasp and communicate complex ideas technology Experience with Microsoft tools  Word, Outlook, Excel, Project, Visio and PowerPoint Apply

title: Co-operative Bank Need IT Security Operations Centre Analyst SOC
description: 90 IT Security Operations Centre Analyst SOC Job Ad expires on May 11th, 2025 As a market leader, we are dedicated towards creating and achieving excellence and the only way we can do it is through our people. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and a strong team ethic. We therefore provide you with a superior foundation for building a professional career  a place for people to learn, to achieve and to grow. Here is one such opportunity for you to explore. We are on the lookout for a highly motivated and result-oriented individual who demonstrates initiative, good interpersonal and communications skills. Directly reporting to the Lead-SOC, the SOC Analyst will work collaboratively with other ICT Security functions, Technology and Enterprise Services, ICT Risk and Control, and Security Services teams to detect and respond to information security incidents, maintain, and follow procedures for security event alerting and participate in ICT related security investigations. The Role Specifically, the successful jobholder will be required to: Be part of a 24hr active Monitoring and analysis of the Banks networks for malicious activity using Security Incident and Event Management SIEM toolsets. This will include responding to and investigating alerts, assisting with developing new security monitoring use cases, and ensuring all investigative activity is properly documented in the banks ticketing systems and followed by relevant support teams. Conduct proactive cyber threat research  analysis. Monitoring open-source intelligence sources for potential threats against the Bank,  ensuring appropriate defensive actions are taken. Triage and investigate alerts generated from various security monitoring solutions and SIEM; indicators of compromise IOCs like file hashes, IP addresses, domains, etc. and escalate them to the ICT respective units and ensure that appropriate follow-up actions are taken to mitigate the exposure. Document all activities during an incident and provide leadership with status updates during the life cycle of the incident. Analyze a variety of network and host-based security appliance logs Firewalls, NIDS, HIDS, Sys Logs, etc. to determine the corrective or mitigation actions and escalation paths for each incident. Independently follow procedures to contain, analyze, and eradicate malicious activity. Be available, on-call, to rapidly troubleshoot any problems resulting from infrastructure changes, security breaches, or other unplannedunforeseen circumstances. Assist the ICT Security team in developing and maintaining SoC documentation and processes. Form part of the Banks Security Incident Response team, assisting with whatever activities are deemed necessary by the incident leader. Submit period and ad-hoc reports as required by HOD Skills, Competencies and Experience The successful candidate will be required to have the following skills and competencies: Bachelors degree in information technology, computer science or any related field. CISSP CISACISMCEHCertified SOC analyst CSASecurityNetworkCCNASSCP or other related certifications. 1 years experience as a SecurityNetwork Administrator or equivalent knowledge. Technical knowledge of databases, networks, and operating systems security. Knowledge of various security methodologies and processes, and technical security solutions firewall and intrusion detection systems. Knowledge and experience using one or more tools related to SIEM, intrusion detection and prevention systems, network security managers, firewalls and end point logging. Knowledge of TCPIP Protocols, network analysis, and networksecurity applications. Strong written communication skills in report writing for incident reporting Knowledge of specific tools and languages such as Wireshark, PowerShell, Python and SQL knowledge highly desirable. How to apply If you are confident that you fit the role and person profile and you are keen to add value to your career then please forward your application letter enclosing detailed Curriculum Vitae to jobsco-opbank.co.ke indicating the job reference number SOC1IID2025 by 11th May, 2025 . We are an equal opportunity employer

title: Safaricom Hiring Android Developer Engineer Fixed Customer SupportCyber Security Roles
description: 105 Safaricom PLC, Kenyas leading mobile network operator and digital services provider, is inviting qualified and passionate individuals to apply for a range of exciting career opportunities within its dynamic and forward-looking organization. With a reputation for innovation, customer-centric solutions, and excellence in service delivery, Safaricom offers an outstanding platform for professionals eager to contribute to transformative digital solutions and cutting-edge customer experiences. As part of its ongoing commitment to providing unmatched services in technology, cybersecurity, digital finance, and customer operations, Safaricom is recruiting for the following positions: Android Developer  Nairobi, Kenya Engineer  Fixed Customer Support  Kenya Cyber Security Roles  M-Pesa Africa Evergreen Application  Kenya Senior Officer, Fraud Strategy and Analytics  Safaricom House, Kenya Below is a comprehensive overview of each position including key duties and responsibilities. 1. Android Developer Location: Nairobi, Kenya Posting Date: 30th June 2025 Role Summary: Safaricom is seeking a highly skilled and passionate Android Developer to join its Technology Division. The role requires an individual with a strong grasp of mobile software development and a keen eye for user experience and mobile app performance. The ideal candidate will design, build, test, and maintain Android applications that serve millions of users across the region. Key Responsibilities: Develop and maintain advanced applications for the Android platform. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features. Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency. Work closely with product managers, UIUX designers, and backend engineers to craft elegant and efficient solutions. Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications. Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs. Contribute to code quality by writing clean, maintainable, and scalable code. Participate in regular code reviews and agile development processes. Expected Deliverables: Fully functional and user-friendly Android applications aligned with business requirements. Documented code and well-articulated technical designs. Timely bug resolution and system performance optimization. 2. Engineer  Fixed Customer Support Location: Kenya Posting Date: 30th June 2025 Role Summary: This position is based within the Technology Converged Service Operations Department and focuses on supporting fixed customer connectivity services. The Engineer  Fixed Customer Support will play a critical role in ensuring optimal performance of customer services, delivering a seamless support experience, and driving customer satisfaction for home and enterprise fixed services. Key Responsibilities: Provide Level 2 technical support for fixed service incidents including Fiber to the Home FTTH, Fixed Wireless Access FWA, and enterprise solutions. Troubleshoot and resolve fixed network faults within defined SLAs. Engage with field operations and vendors to ensure efficient fault resolution and installations. Analyze incident trends and provide feedback for service improvement. Update and manage incident records in the service management system accurately and timely. Coordinate proactive maintenance and preventive measures for the fixed access network. Escalate unresolved issues to relevant departments and ensure customer communication throughout the incident lifecycle. Liaise with internal teams including Network Operations and Engineering for collaborative troubleshooting. Expected Deliverables: High first-contact resolution rate for fixed service issues. Updated incident records and technical documentation. Reduced customer complaints through proactive issue management. Comprehensive incident trend reports and root-cause analyses. 3. M-Pesa Africa Cyber Security  Evergreen Application Multiple Roles Location: Kenya Posting Date: 26th June 2025 Role Summary: M-Pesa Africa is continuously sourcing for experienced professionals in Cyber Security to support its rapidly growing digital financial ecosystem. These roles span various disciplines within cybersecurity and are critical to the security, integrity, and trustworthiness of M-Pesa platforms across Africa. Roles Under Evergreen Application May Include: Security Analysts Cyber Threat Intelligence Experts SOC Engineers Security Operations Managers Cloud Security Engineers Application Security Specialists Compliance and Risk Officers Penetration Testers Ethical Hackers Key Responsibilities across various roles: Monitor, analyze, and respond to security incidents across M-Pesa environments. Design and implement security tools, protocols, and best practices. Perform vulnerability assessments, penetration tests, and risk evaluations. Collaborate with development and DevOps teams to embed security in the software development lifecycle SDLC. Maintain regulatory compliance through effective risk management frameworks. Provide training and awareness on cybersecurity to internal teams. Support audits, forensic investigations, and threat modeling efforts. Ensure secure configuration and monitoring of cloud services and infrastructure. Expected Deliverables: Enhanced security posture of M-Pesa systems and applications. Accurate and timely response to emerging cyber threats and vulnerabilities. Documentation of security controls, incident reports, and compliance assessments. Continuous improvement in security maturity across the organization. Note: This is an evergreen application pool. Candidates will be considered for various openings as they arise based on qualifications and business needs. Why Work at Safaricom? Safaricom is not just a telecommunications company; it is a hub of innovation, technology, and transformation in Kenya and beyond. By joining the Safaricom team, you become part of a purpose-driven organization that values innovation, inclusion, integrity, and excellence. You will benefit from: A vibrant and diverse workplace culture Opportunities to work on impactful, large-scale projects Professional growth and career advancement Competitive compensation and employee benefits Access to world-class learning platforms and mentorship If you are passionate about technology, innovation, and making a meaningful impact, Safaricom offers the perfect environment to achieve your career aspirations. Review the role that fits your skills and experience and submit your application through the Safaricom Careers Portal. Apply Now

description: 126 Are you looking for a new professional challenge in 2025? An esteemed organization with operations across Kenya is inviting applications from qualified, innovative, and performance-driven professionals to fill several vacancies across multiple departments. This latest hiring round includes strategic leadership roles, tech-focused development positions, HR, communications, cyber security, user research, product management, and business analytics. These roles provide an excellent opportunity for experienced professionals to thrive in a dynamic, innovation-driven environment, working on cutting-edge technologies, leading cross-functional teams, and contributing to the digital and organizational transformation of one of the regions top institutions.
