description: 26 The United States Mission in Nairobi, Kenya, through Embassy Nairobi, invites applications from qualified and interested individuals for the position of Security Support Assistant. This recruitment exercise is open to all interested applicants and is conducted in line with the Missions commitment to maintaining a safe, secure, and well-coordinated working environment for U.S. Government facilities, personnel, dependents, and visitors. The position is locally employed and is based in Nairobi, with two vacancies available. Security operations form a critical component of the Missions overall mandate. The ability to anticipate, observe, document, and respond to security-related developments is essential to ensuring that official operations are carried out without disruption and that personnel and property remain protected. The Security Support Assistant plays a key role in supporting the Regional Security Office by providing timely, accurate, and actionable security information. Through consistent reporting, analysis of observable trends, and participation in operational security activities, the role contributes directly to situational awareness and informed decision-making. This job advertisement is intended for publication on a third-party job board and presents a comprehensive overview of the position, including the scope of work, reporting relationships, duty location, work schedule, and application process. The article is written in a neutral, professional tone and uses a third-person perspective throughout. All information included is drawn from the official announcement and position description. Position Overview Announcement Number: Nairobi-2025-039 Hiring Agency: Embassy Nairobi Position Title: Security Support Assistant  All Interested Applicants Open Period: January 14, 2026 to January 28, 2026 Vacancy Time Zone: GMT 3 SeriesGrade: LE  0710 4 Salary: KES 1,504,499 to KES 2,662,955 per year Work Schedule: Full-time, 45 hours per week Promotion Potential: LE-4 Duty Location: Nairobi, Kenya two vacancies Telework Eligible: No Appointment Type: Permanent Appointment Type Details: Indefinite, subject to successful completion of the probationary period Supervisory Position: No Relocation Expenses Reimbursed: No Travel Required: Not required Security Clearance Required: Public Trust  Background Investigation The successful candidates must be able to begin working within a reasonable period, defined as within four weeks of receipt of agency authorization andor required clearances or certifications. Failure to do so may result in the termination of candidacy. This position reports to the Regional Security Office and works under the direction of supervisory security personnel. The role does not involve supervisory responsibilities but requires close coordination with other security staff and relevant Mission components. Scope of the Role The Security Support Assistant provides direct operational and analytical support to the Regional Security Office. The primary focus of the position is to collect, observe, document, analyze, and report security-related information that may affect U.S. Government interests. The role requires a high level of situational awareness, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate observations clearly and accurately. The position involves a significant amount of time spent outdoors and in the field. The incumbent may be required to work in varying environmental and weather conditions and across different shifts, depending on operational requirements. In addition to routine observation and reporting duties, the Security Support Assistant may be tasked with other security-related functions as directed by supervisors. The overall objective of the role is to ensure that the Regional Security Office has access to up-to-date, relevant, and reliable security data. This information supports planning, threat assessment, and response coordination, contributing to the Missions overall security posture. Detailed Job Description Security Support Functions Approximately 90 percent of time The core responsibility of the Security Support Assistant is to conduct security support and analysis within an assigned area of responsibility. This function involves systematic observation, information gathering, and assessment of activities that may have security implications. The job holder is responsible for identifying and observing suspicious or unusual activities within the designated area. This includes monitoring pedestrian and vehicular movements, public gatherings, and other activities that could indicate potential threats or emerging security concerns. Observations are made with the objective of detecting behaviors, patterns, or situations that may pose a risk to U.S. Government facilities, personnel, family members, or residences. The role requires close and continuous observation of the surrounding environment. The Security Support Assistant is expected to remain alert to changes in routine patterns, the presence of unfamiliar individuals or vehicles, and any indicators of surveillance or hostile intent. Information gathered through these observations is documented accurately and in a timely manner. The incumbent collects security-related information from open sources and direct observation. This information is organized and tabulated to support analysis of trends in criminal tactics, techniques, and procedures. The Security Support Assistant may be required to track recurring incidents, identify emerging threats, and note shifts in the local security environment. Another key aspect of the role is the initiation of appropriate responses to potential threats. When necessary, the job holder initiates emergency responses in accordance with established procedures to safeguard life and property. This may involve alerting supervisory security personnel, coordinating with other security staff, or taking immediate action within the scope of assigned authority. The Security Support Assistant supports the Regional Security Office by ensuring that collected information is current, relevant, and presented in a format that facilitates decision-making. The role requires the ability to synthesize observations into coherent assessments that can be used for briefings and operational planning. In addition to routine observation and analysis, the position may involve participation in special security operations or tasks as directed. These tasks are assigned based on operational needs and may vary over time. Flexibility and readiness to support a range of security functions are essential components of the role. Reporting Functions Approximately 10 percent of time Reporting is a critical component of the Security Support Assistant position. The job holder is responsible for producing both verbal and written reports based on observations and findings. Written reports include situation reports, incident reports, and other documentation required by the Regional Security Office. These reports must be clear, concise, and accurate, providing sufficient detail to support understanding and follow-up action. The ability to document events objectively and systematically is central to this function. Verbal reporting involves briefing supervisory security personnel on observed activities, incidents, or emerging trends. These briefings must be delivered in a clear and structured manner, highlighting key points and relevant details. The Security Support Assistant may be called upon to provide updates during meetings or in response to specific inquiries. The role may also require maintaining records and performing data entry into designated software applications. This includes entering observation data, incident details, and other security-related information into systems used by the Regional Security Office. Accuracy and consistency in data entry are essential to maintaining reliable records. Reporting duties support the broader security analysis process by ensuring that information collected in the field is effectively communicated to decision-makers. Through timely and accurate reporting, the Security Support Assistant contributes to the Missions ability to assess risks and respond appropriately. Work Environment and Conditions The Security Support Assistant position is full-time, with a standard work schedule of 45 hours per week. However, operational requirements may necessitate work outside of standard hours, including evenings, weekends, or holidays. Shift work may be required to ensure continuous security coverage. The role involves extended periods of time outdoors and may require standing, walking, or remaining alert for prolonged durations. The incumbent may be exposed to varying weather conditions and is expected to perform duties effectively in such environments. The position is based in Nairobi and does not offer telework options. All duties are performed on site or within assigned areas of responsibility. Travel is not required as part of the role, and relocation expenses are not reimbursed. Compensation and Benefits Information The position is classified under the LE  0710 4 seriesgrade and offers an annual salary ranging from KES 1,504,499 to KES 2,662,955. The final salary is determined in accordance with the Missions pay plan and is assigned by the Human Resources Office at the time of the conditional offer. Locally Employed Staff working at the U.S. Mission in Nairobi may receive a compensation package that includes health benefits, separation benefits, and other applicable benefits. Eligibility and specific benefit entitlements are determined by Mission policies and applicable regulations. Equal Employment Opportunity The U.S. Mission is committed to providing equal opportunity and fair and equitable treatment in employment. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, political affiliation, marital status, or sexual orientation. This commitment applies to all aspects of employment, including recruitment, selection, and placement. Hiring Preference Information The hiring preference selection process is applied in accordance with established guidelines. Applicants who fall within specific hiring preference categories may be extended preference in the order prescribed by policy. Applicants are responsible for accurately describing their status during the application process and for submitting required documentation to support their eligibility for preference consideration. Application Process All candidates must be able to obtain and hold a Police Clearance Certificate and provide a Credit Reference Bureau certificate as part of the application and selection process. Applications are submitted through the designated online application system. Applicants are required to click the Submit Application button and follow the instructions provided on the Missions website. Detailed guidance on how to apply is available on the Mission internet site. Applicants must ensure that all required documents are submitted by the closing date of the announcement. Failure to provide requested documentation or submission of insufficient information may result in disqualification from consideration. Required documentation may include, where applicable, proof of residency or work authorization, educational certificates, licenses, and other supporting documents specified in the application instructions. Next Steps in the Selection Process Applicants who are shortlisted may be invited to participate in language or skills testing andor interviews. Communication regarding tests, interviews, and selection decisions will be conducted via email. Additional information, including the complete position description and further details on duties and responsibilities, may be obtained by contacting the Human Resources Office at the U.S. Mission in Nairobi. Closing Statement The Security Support Assistant role offers an opportunity to contribute to the safety and security of U.S. Government operations in Kenya. Through diligent observation, accurate reporting, and effective support to the Regional Security Office, the successful candidates will play an important role in maintaining a secure operating environment. Interested applicants are encouraged to review the announcement carefully, ensure that all application requirements are met, and submit their applications within the stated open period. Apply Now

At the University of Eastern Africa, Baraton, Baraton Jeremic Community Medical Centre which takes care of the health issues of everybody around the area. Baraton Jeremic Community Medical Centre is seeking a dedicated and experienced Anaesthetist to join our dynamic medical team. The successful candidate is expected to provide high-quality anaesthetic services for surgical, diagnostic, and therapeutic procedures, ensuring the highest standards of patient safety and care throughout the perioperative period. As a healthcare institution affiliated with the Seventh-day Adventist Church, we embrace a holistic philosophy of care that integrates the spiritual, physical, and social wellbeing of every individual. We therefore seek for a professional who not only demonstrates clinical excellence but also resonates with our values of compassion, integrity, respect, and service to humanity. title: Equity Bank Hiring Senior Security Domain Architect
description: 19 Equity Group Holdings is a diversified financial services organization with operations spanning banking, insurance, investment services, and technology-driven financial solutions. As the organization continues to expand its digital footprint and strengthen its enterprise technology landscape, information security remains a critical enabler of sustainable growth, operational resilience, and customer trust. In response to increasing complexity in enterprise systems, cloud adoption, emerging technologies, and evolving cyber threats, Equity Group Holdings seeks to strengthen its cybersecurity leadership through the recruitment of a Senior Security Domain Architect. This role is positioned at a strategic and technical intersection, responsible for shaping, governing, and advancing enterprise security architecture across multiple technology domains. The Senior Security Domain Architect will play a central role in defining and implementing enterprise-wide security architectures that align with business objectives, regulatory expectations, and global best practices. The position requires close collaboration with business stakeholders, enterprise architecture teams, engineering functions, and cybersecurity specialists to ensure that security is embedded into platforms, applications, and infrastructure from design through operation. This opportunity is suited for an experienced cybersecurity professional with a strong background in security architecture, enterprise technology environments, and risk-driven security design. The role operates within a complex organizational structure and requires the ability to translate strategic security objectives into practical, scalable, and measurable architectural solutions. Position Overview The Senior Security Domain Architect will be responsible for the development, review, and governance of enterprise information security architectures and solutions across a wide range of domains. These include data security, infrastructure security, Active Directory security, identity and access management, network security, cloud environments, Internet of Things, blockchain technologies, and emerging digital platforms. The role is accountable for ensuring adherence to established architecture standards while continuously evolving the security architecture to address new risks, technologies, and business requirements. The position contributes directly to the organizations cybersecurity roadmap and supports the optimization of advanced security and emerging technology controls. Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities Enterprise Security Architecture Strategy The Senior Security Domain Architect will provide expert direction in implementing the organizations enterprise security architecture strategy. This includes platforms, applications, security services, network security, and infrastructure. The role requires an in-depth understanding of the organizations existing technology deployments, associated risks, and future-state ambitions. The architect will assess current security capabilities, identify architectural gaps, and design target-state architectures that strengthen the overall security posture. This work will be aligned with business priorities, regulatory obligations, and industry standards, ensuring that security solutions are both effective and practical. Collaboration and Security Enablement The role requires close collaboration with Information Security, Compliance, Cyber Defense, Product Security, and Engineering teams. Through these partnerships, the Senior Security Domain Architect will help secure and automate security capabilities across the enterprise. This includes working with development and engineering teams to embed security controls into systems and services, supporting secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles. The architect will also support the integration of security services into broader technology solutions to ensure consistency and efficiency. Design and Protection of Information Assets The Senior Security Domain Architect will define and advise on the design, implementation, and operational processes required to protect information system assets. This includes data, applications, infrastructure, and identity services across on-premises and cloud environments. The role involves translating business requirements, risk assessments, and high-level security policies into concrete architecture requirements and solution designs. These designs will support both existing environments and new initiatives, ensuring that security considerations are addressed early in project lifecycles. Project Engagement and Advisory The position requires active participation in discussions related to high-level IT and operational process design. The Senior Security Domain Architect will advise project teams on security requirements, architectural patterns, and implementation approaches to ensure that security objectives are met without unduly impacting business outcomes. The architect will act as a security subject matter expert across multiple domains, including cloud, IoT, blockchain, identity and access management, data and application security, network security, database security, and infrastructure security. Cross-Domain Support and Knowledge Sharing While the primary focus is on the assigned security domains, the Senior Security Domain Architect is expected to contribute knowledge and expertise to support other cybersecurity domain architects. This may include areas such as mainframe security, public key infrastructure, cryptography, platform security, application security, DevSecOps, and related disciplines. This collaborative approach ensures consistency across security domains and supports the development of cohesive, enterprise-wide security architectures. Stakeholder Engagement The role involves engagement with a wide range of stakeholders, including business owners, business analysts, project leaders, enterprise architects, risk management teams, internal and external auditors, IT engineers, developers, and solution designers. The Senior Security Domain Architect must be able to communicate complex security concepts clearly and effectively, tailoring messages to different audiences and levels of technical understanding. Application and Domain Security Oversight The position holds responsibility for application security, supported by a strong working knowledge of other security domains such as cryptography, identity and access management, threat and vulnerability management, infrastructure and network security, auditing, logging, and compliance. The architect will ensure that application security requirements are integrated into development processes, architectural standards, and operational practices. Digital Investigations and Incident Response The role requires proven ability to follow established global standards in digital evidence acquisition and handling. The Senior Security Domain Architect will have experience conducting digital investigations and supporting incident response activities, including the management of insider threats and cyber or data exfiltration incidents. This capability supports the organizations readiness to respond to security incidents effectively and in compliance with regulatory and legal requirements. Cybersecurity Roadmap and Reporting The Senior Security Domain Architect will support the delivery of the organizations three-year cybersecurity roadmap. This includes maintaining and optimizing advanced cybersecurity and emerging technology controls to ensure that the organization remains resilient against evolving threats. The role also involves leading the enhancement and optimization of reporting mechanisms to demonstrate the value of advanced cybersecurity capabilities. Reporting will focus on tangible benefits, risk reduction, and alignment with business objectives. Policy, Standards, and Regulatory Alignment The position requires adherence to information security policies, methods, and standards, including National Institute of Standards and Technology standards and practices. The Senior Security Domain Architect will interpret regulations and apply them to organizational information systems and IT reference materials. The architect will help coordinate the implementation of security programs across all platforms, ensuring consistency and compliance across the enterprise. Infrastructure and Directory Services Support The role includes assisting with Active Directory access management, group policies, internet intrusion detection, internet filtering, and monitoring of employee access. Responsibilities also extend to supporting virtual private networking and LANWAN security. The Senior Security Domain Architect will participate as an advisor in projects aimed at enhancing or developing new IT systems or evaluating the feasibility of acquiring new technologies. Security Architecture Communication and Strategy The architect will develop and document security architecture artifacts and communicate these to senior leadership, including the General Manager, Enterprise Security Architecture team, and the Chief Information Security Officer. This includes ensuring that security architecture decisions are transparent, well-documented, and aligned with strategic objectives. Qualifications Knowledge and Experience The role requires a degree or equivalent in information technology, network security, enterprise network management, information security, management information systems, engineering, or a related field. The position requires a minimum of ten years of progressively complex experience in cybersecurity within a global environment, including at least five years in security architecture and network or infrastructure security. Network security architecture experience is required, with a deep technical understanding of designing and securing wide area and local area network environments. This includes technologies such as software-defined WAN, MPLS, VPNs, segmentation, micro-segmentation, factory segmentation, routing, and switching. Experience with professional architecture and security frameworks such as TOGAF, SABSA, or IAF is expected. Security certifications such as CEH, CISA, CCISO, CISSP, GIAC, ISO 27001 Lead Auditor or Lead Implementer, or equivalent product-specific certifications are considered an asset. Cloud security experience is required, including technical understanding of virtualization, cloud infrastructure, and public cloud offerings. This includes experience designing network security configurations and controls in cloud-based solutions, particularly within Microsoft Azure and Azure platform services. The role requires experience designing, implementing, deploying, and operating vulnerability scanning infrastructure and services, as well as selecting, testing, and supporting endpoint detection and response technologies. Experience integrating common infrastructure security technologies into business solution architectures is essential. This includes identity and access management, intrusion detection and prevention, security monitoring, and data encryption solutions. Strong verbal and written communication skills are required, along with the ability to collaborate effectively and present complex topics to senior leadership. The position requires experience designing and implementing secure architectures and reference architectures, from business requirements gathering through technology rollout and oversight. This includes capacity management, technology selection methodologies, tool integration, reporting, and technical documentation. A strong understanding of modern security principles, application security architecture, security technologies, standards, techniques, and protocols is required. Hands-on experience deploying security technologies is expected, including next-generation firewalls, intrusion prevention systems, anti-malware solutions, endpoint security technologies, security information and event management systems, authentication systems, log management, content filtering, wireless access controls, virtualization technologies, network access control, identity management technologies, cloud security technologies, data encryption technologies, and mobile application security. The role requires excellent understanding of identity and access management design and processes, directory services, and technology security risk management. Key Critical Competencies The Senior Security Domain Architect must demonstrate the ability to implement solutions with consideration for wider organizational impacts, including risk, cost, customer experience, and delivery timelines. Strong negotiation skills and the ability to communicate effectively in both written and verbal formats are required. The role involves handling high-pressure situations and engaging with key stakeholders across the organization. Analytical thinking, problem-solving capability, and strong interpersonal skills are essential for success in this role. Conclusion This role offers an opportunity to contribute to the strategic direction and operational resilience of a large and complex organization. The Senior Security Domain Architect will play a key role in shaping enterprise security architecture, supporting business transformation, and ensuring that cybersecurity capabilities evolve in line with emerging technologies and threats. The position is suited for an experienced cybersecurity professional seeking a leadership role with significant influence on enterprise-wide security strategy and implementation. Job Opportunity Announcement: Senior Security Domain Architect Organization: Equity Group Holdings Employment Type: Regular Job Level: Manager Job Shift: Day Job Job Posting Date: January 5, 2026 Apply Now

title: British High Commission Hiring Health Security Adviser, British Office Sudan 4225 NR
description: 29 The British Government is an inclusive and diversity-friendly employer. We value difference, promote equality and challenge discrimination, enhancing our organisational capability. We welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We do not discriminate on the basis of disability, race, colour, ethnicity, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation, age, veteran status or other category protected by law. We promote family-friendly flexible working opportunities, where operational and security needs allow. The FCDO operates an agile workforce and to facilitate this, you may be required to undertake other duties from time to time, as we may reasonably require.Job Category Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office Programme RolesJob Subcategory Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office Programme RolesJob Description Roles and Responsibilities Main purpose of job: The British Office Sudan is looking for a high performing candidate to push forward the UK governments engagement in the Sudanese health sector and take forward implementation of our future direct health investments on lifesaving humanitarian interventions and Sexual Reproductive Health and Rights SHRH, and influence our wider multilateral investments in strengthening the primary health care landscape, improving vaccination coverage and increasing disease surveillance capabilities in Sudan. The FCDO is a leading humanitarian donor in Sudan and wants to take a more active role than it has done in the past in shaping the future of health sector. The post-holder will represent the UK in health-focused interactions with the wider donor community, implementing partners and authorities in Sudan. This post offers an opportunity to contribute to delivering better impact and results in one of the most complex and difficult environments in which the FCDO works. The British Office Sudan has had long term investments in strengthening sexual and reproductive health services and we are one the of largest donors to both the Global Vaccine Alliance and Global Health Fund, both of which have large programmes in Sudan. We are also looking to work more closely with the World Bank and African Development Bank on their agenda to strengthen the primary healthcare landscape. We also ensure want to ensure that within our humanitarian funding, we actively pursue opportunities to strengthen disease surveillance and reduce health risks in humanitarian hot spots. Engagement with multilaterals and a range of centrally managed FCDO programmes including the WISH 2 Dividend and Ensuring Quality Access and Learning for mothers and newborns in conflict-affected contexts EQUAL is an important element of the portfolio. The post holder will be a member of the dynamic Humanitarian and Human Development Team HHD and work closely with the G7 Human Development Adviser and G6 Senior Humanitarian Adviser. The post holder will be expected to actively collaborate with British Office Sudan colleagues to ensure the health interventions conflict sensitive, and well-coordinated with overall humanitarian objectives. The post is open on to Grade 7 level Health Advisers. Previous experience in a conflict and fragile states post would be particularly welcome, and working level Arabic would be desirable. Roles and responsibilities: We all have a responsibility to embrace the changes of the FCDO as it transforms, building the culture we want to see and delivering our cultural statement in how we lead and behave towards others; how we make decisions and how we get the job done is everyones responsibility. In this role you will be responsible for: Convening the Global Health Institutional representatives for Sudan and other multilateral and bilateral donors to improve coherence through the establishment of a functional and effective health donor working group supported by one other bilateral donor Influence a pivot from multilateral partners working in the Sudan health sector, which improves their delivery record and helps to identify interventions that they can deliver to strengthen long term delivery systems in Sudan Help the British Office Sudan assess and prepare options for how humanitarian funding instruments might be able to strengthen primary health care systems in neglected and hard to reach parts of the country Assess the disease surveillance landscape in Sudan and identify mechanisms for how the UK can strengthen surveillance gaps, particularly at a local level through our partnerships with frontline humanitarian responders. Provide sufficient internal information, analysis and early warning internally on disease outbreaks, then help to think about strengthening external surveillance capabilities with WHO. Provide oversight to our collective sexual and reproductive health work, including more detailed understanding of the Minimum Integrated Service Package service functionality outlook, commodities pipeline and blockages. Engage with Centrally Management Programmes delivering in Sudan. Engaging with and overseeingquality assuring implementing partners to confirm delivery of health programme objectives in line with international standards and best practice and support adaptation to the context. Providing high quality technical information and advice in a timely manner for briefings, communications pieces, analyses, case studies and results data. Contributing to the health cadres delivery across FCDO through 10 work and continuous professional development. The successful candidate will have a demonstrable track record of delivering health outcomes at practitioner level in the health technical competencies. You will be recognised for your technical knowledge andor skill which will be underpinned by experience working on technical issues. More information is available in the health technical competency framework Health: Technical Competency Framework, May 2024 If you are successful and are not already accredited to the health cadre, you will have the option of seeking accreditation and will be supported to do so.Essential qualifications, skills and experience Experience of designing and delivering health programmes at scale in developing country contexts. Experience of working with a range of stakeholders including government, donors, implementing partners and multilaterals on health policy and programming. Experience of delivering health outcomes at practitioner level in the health technical competencies. Strong communication and interpersonal skills; Personal resilience Desirable qualifications, skills and experience A demonstrable track record of resilience or experience in contexts similar to Sudan. Ability to work at pace and under pressure to tight deadlines. Ability to prioritise against multiple demands. title: CIFOR-ICRAF Hiring Senior Officer  Network Infrastructure and Security
description: 54 Senior Officer  Network Infrastructure and SecurityInternal Vacancy Reference number: 202566 Job status: In-progress Job category: Local Position Duty station: Nairobi, Kenya Download PDF: CIFOR-ICRAF The Center for International Forestry Research CIFOR and World Agroforestry ICRAF envision a more equitable world where trees in all landscapes, from drylands to the humid tropics, enhance the environment and well-being for all. CIFOR and ICRAF are non-profit science institutions that build and apply evidence to todays most pressing challenges, including energy insecurity and the climate and biodiversity crises. Over a combined total of 65 years, we have built vast knowledge on forests and trees outside of forests in agricultural landscapes agroforestry. Using a multidisciplinary approach, we seek to improve lives and to protect and restore ecosystems. Our work focuses on innovative research, partnering for impact, and engaging with stakeholders on policies and practices to benefit people and the planet. Founded in 1993 and 1978, CIFOR and ICRAF are members of CGIAR, a global research partnership for a food secure future dedicated to reducing poverty, enhancing food and nutrition security, and improving natural resources. CIFOR-ICRAF is looking for a Senior Officer  Network Infrastructure and SecurityInternal Vacancy Overview The Senior Officer  Network Infrastructure and Security role involves participating in the design, implementation, optimization, maintenance, and support of a secure, efficient, and scalable network infrastructure and services. This role ensures smooth operation, security, and high availability of the organizations network infrastructure to meet business objectives and SLAs. Duties and responsibilities 1.Network Infrastructure Support: Participate in the design, configuration, installation, testing, and management of network hardware switches, routers, wireless access points, firewalls and software. Participate in Planning, deployment, and maintenance of a scalable and secure network infrastructure. Manage and support PBX, video conferencing, and collaboration tools. 2. Network Monitoring  Performance Optimization: Continuously monitor network health. Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks to ensure seamless connectivity. Assist in the design and implementation of traffic management and Quality of Service QoS policies Monitor network performance, availability, and security. 3. Security Operations: Review security logs, perform basic vulnerability assessments, implement security policies, and contributing to incident response activities. Help enforce network and security policies and best practices across the organization. Perform security updates and patches. 4. Documentation and Training Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation, including network diagrams, inventory lists, and configuration details. Log all support activities and resolutions in the ticketing system. Contribute to the development of IT knowledge base, technical guidelines, standard operating procedures, and policies. Building capacity within the unit and in countries 5. Collaboration Work closely with ICT team members, departments, and external service providers and vendors to ensure efficient operation and resolution of issues. Collaborate with the regional offices teams to provide network infrastructure support and resolution of issues. 6. Troubleshooting  Support Provide timely technical support for network and security-related issues reported by end-users or identified through monitoring e.g., connectivity problems, VPN issues, slow performance, firewall access requests. Investigate and resolve network incidents, ensuring rapid restoration of services. 7. Business Continuity  Disaster Recovery Assist in scheduling and managing network routine Preventive Maintenance tasks as per laid down standards. Assist in disaster recovery planning and rapid response to network outages. Ensure redundancy in infrastructure, including backup links, failover mechanisms. Conduct regular backup testing and infrastructure resilience assessments. 8. Infrastructure and security Projects Participate in the delivery of infrastructure-related projects per role assigned Work with cross-functional teams to implement network-related projects Participate in the supervision of projects and documentation. 9. Country Offices Support Support the establishment, monitoring, maintenance, and support of the country offices network infrastructure and security. Beyond Network Infrastructure and security, extend general ICT and user support as well as training to country offices users whenever they visit the country offices. Requirements Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, Computer Technology, or a closely related field, combined with 56 years of progressively responsible experience in ICT user support, network infrastructure management, and cybersecurity operations. Training in IT Service Management, Network infrastructure, and cybersecurity. Desirable areas include: ITIL and CCNAJNCIAHCNACyberSecurity Proven hands-on networking experience Network Infrastructure: Strong understanding of network architecture, routing, switching, firewalls, and VPN technologies. In-depth knowledge of dynamic and static routing protocols, QoS strategies. Knowledge of Datacenter architecture is an added advantage. Knowledge of network services and protocols including DNS, DHCP,NAT, SNMP, TCPIP Cybersecurity: Proficiency in security frameworks, threat mitigation, intrusion detection, and risk management. Monitoring  Incident Response: Experience in real-time network monitoring, performance analysis, and handling security incidents. Business Continuity  Disaster Recovery: Knowledge of redundancy planning, failover solutions, and recovery strategies. Systems Administration: Familiarity with operating systems Windows, Linux, cloud platforms, and virtualization technologies. Experience in building and documenting Processes and Procedures. Training in IT Service Management, Network infrastructure, and cybersecurity. Knowledge of network services and protocols including DNS, DHCP,NAT, SNMP, TCPIP Cybersecurity: Proficiency in security frameworks, threat mitigation, intrusion detection, and risk management. Business Continuity  Disaster Recovery: Knowledge of redundancy planning, failover solutions, and recovery strategies. CIFOR-ICRAF offers competitive remuneration in local currency commensurate with skills and experience. The duty station will be in Nairobi, Kenya CIFOR-ICRAF Offices and offers services and support to country offices remotely and through scheduled visits. title: The European External Action Service EEAS Hiring Regional Security Officer RSO
description: 72 The European External Action Service EEAS has announced a new opportunity for skilled professionals interested in serving as Regional Security Officers RSO within the European Union Delegations worldwide. Through this call for expression of interest, the EEAS seeks to establish a reserve list for future recruitments of RSOs under the category of Contract Agents Function Group III FGIII . The EEAS functions as the diplomatic service of the European Union, supporting the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy in coordinating and implementing the EUs Common Foreign and Security Policy CFSP. It represents the Union globally, promotes European interests, and ensures the coherence of external actions across 145 Delegations and Offices, including nine attached to international organizations. This recruitment aims to strengthen the network of Regional Security Officers who play a vital role in advising, coordinating, and implementing security policies and crisis management procedures to safeguard EU staff, assets, and missions abroad. Overview of the Position Job Title: Regional Security Officer RSO Category: Contract Agent Function Group III Article 3a of CEOS Location: EU Delegations worldwide Mobility Allowance LCA: 0  40 Contract Type: Initial 3-year contract, renewable for 5 years, with the possibility of an indefinite contract thereafter Recruitment Basis: Reserve list no specific post at the time of application This call for expression of interest is intended to identify and pre-select candidates who may later be appointed to active RSO positions as vacancies arise. Successful applicants will be placed on a reserve list valid for two years, subject to renewal based on operational needs. Job Description: Regional Security Officer RSO The Regional Security Officer will serve under the operational authority of the EEAS Field Security Division FSD and the administrative supervision of both the FSD and the Head of Delegation. The role involves extensive field coordination, advisory responsibilities, and operational security management across designated regions or Delegations. The positions core objective is to ensure the effective implementation of the EUs duty of care obligations by protecting staff, dependents, assets, and classified information under challenging and often high-risk international conditions. The main responsibilities are divided into the following functional areas: 1. Risk Analysis The RSO will provide ongoing risk and threat assessments in relation to EU Delegation activities in designated countries or regions. Key duties include: Advising the Field Security Division and relevant EEAS divisions on country-specific threats and recommending appropriate preventive and mitigating security measures. Preparing, maintaining, and updating local threat and security risk assessments, including analysis of Travel Clearance Applications. Conducting surveys of premises and accommodation to evaluate vulnerabilities and recommend necessary security improvements aligned with EEAS Security Guidelines and Standards. Developing, updating, and monitoring the Delegations Security Action Plan to ensure its compliance with operational requirements and situational developments. 2. Analysis and Advisory Functions RSOs are expected to support both Headquarters and field operations in maintaining building security, safety compliance, and operational oversight. Responsibilities in this domain include: Advising on the security design of new and existing Delegation premises and ensuring adherence to EU protection standards. Supervising security-related works, installations, and testing the performance of completed security systems. Performing routine safety checks, including the maintenance and operational functionality of fire safety equipment, smoke detectors, and medical kits. Providing regular advice to Security Management Teams SMT and Heads of Administration on the functionality and effectiveness of security installations and equipment. Supporting EEAS Headquarters in ensuring compliance with EU Classified Information EUCI protection procedures. Offering assistance during medical emergencies, including evacuations or repatriations, in collaboration with Delegation management and EEAS Crisis Response Centre. Conducting pre-deployment briefings for mission personnel traveling to high-risk locations. Advising visiting EU staff, agencies, and institutions under Service Level Arrangements on local security measures and travel safety. 3. Safety, Security, and Crisis Management A crucial element of the RSOs mandate is maintaining security readiness and managing crisis response protocols. Duties include: Contributing to the design, implementation, and supervision of physical security procedures and infrastructure protection. Overseeing the deployment and operational conduct of armed guards, close protection teams, and armoured vehicle use. Managing the use and maintenance of communication systems such as radio networks, satellite phones, and personal protective equipment PPE. Conducting routine communication checks and ensuring personnel are trained in equipment use. Developing and testing contingency plans to ensure operational continuity and effective crisis response, including drills and simulations. Supporting procurement processes related to security contracts, contributing to drafting technical specifications, evaluating tenders, and monitoring contractor performance through key performance indicators KPIs. 4. Communication and Reporting Efficient communication and accurate reporting are essential aspects of the RSOs responsibilities. The role includes: Preparing regular and ad-hoc security reports for the Field Security Division and Delegation Security Management Teams. Contributing to periodic Delegation reports covering security developments, incident trends, and situational updates. Ensuring that contingency plans and security data are up to date and accessible through official EEAS systems. Following up on audit and inspection reports, implementing corrective actions as required. Reporting all security incidents, non-compliance issues, and staff-related safety matters to the Field Security Division. Maintaining contact with security contractors to monitor service delivery and compliance with contractual terms. 5. Training and Awareness RSOs are expected to foster a strong culture of security awareness and preparedness within Delegations. Their tasks in this area include: Organizing and delivering regular security awareness sessions, briefings, and communication updates based on evolving threat levels. Supporting the design and delivery of local Hostile Environment Awareness Training HEAT and other security training sessions for Delegation staff. Monitoring staff compliance with established security protocols and issuing recommendations for improvement. Collaborating with the EEAS Consular Affairs Division in training exercises and the integration of security aspects into consular preparedness. Eligibility Criteria Candidates must meet the eligibility conditions set out under Article 82 of the Conditions of Employment of Other Servants CEOS and relevant EEAS administrative decisions. To be eligible for the RSO position, applicants must: Have successfully passed an EPSO CAST exam for Function Group III or be registered in the Permanent EPSO CAST database for FGIII. Hold at least post-secondary education or secondary education with equivalent professional experience as defined under CEOS. Possess the capacity to work in English and French, which are the main working languages of the EEAS. Be nationals of an EU Member State and enjoy full rights as citizens. Selection Criteria The EEAS seeks candidates with substantial professional experience and leadership skills in the field of security operations and management. Ideal candidates should demonstrate: A minimum of five years of full-time management or coordination experience in law enforcement, military, or intelligence services within EU Member States. Strong theoretical and practical knowledge in Security Operations Management, Risk Management, Crisis Management, and Business Continuity. Experience in managing security operations, particularly in high-threat environments or international missions. Familiarity with security conditions in specific countries, including risks related to conflict, terrorism, organized crime, and civil unrest. Excellent analytical, drafting, and communication skills. Ability to perform effectively under pressure and adapt to multicultural, multidisciplinary work environments. Physical and psychological fitness to perform long-term field assignments under challenging conditions. Proficiency in additional languages such as Spanish, Portuguese, Arabic, Chinese, or Russian is considered an asset. Posting Policy and Duration RSOs are normally assigned to Delegations for a standard posting period of four years. Calls for early mobility or extension are launched annually but remain subject to service requirements. Staff members assigned to non-family posts or Delegations under evacuation level three may apply for reassignment after two years. Temporary assignments to EEAS Headquarters in Brussels are possible in exceptional cases for durations between two and four years, in accordance with EEAS mobility regulations. It is also a requirement that appointed officers be able to complete their full posting before reaching the statutory retirement age. Conditions of Recruitment and Employment All appointments are made under the CEOS provisions and are subject to the following conditions: Conflict of Interest and Security Clearance Applications from individuals with dual nationality of the host country will undergo specific assessment to ensure no conflict of interest exists. Successful candidates must hold or be eligible to obtain a Personnel Security Clearance PSC at the level of SECRET UEEU SECRET issued by their national authority. Medical Clearance Prior to appointment, candidates will undergo a medical and psychological evaluation to confirm fitness for posting in the designated region. Living and Working Conditions Selected candidates are expected to familiarize themselves with the living and security conditions of their assigned duty station, as described in the relevant EEAS Country Post Reports. These conditions may include varying levels of medical facilities, accommodation standards, education availability, and security risks. Equal Opportunity Commitment The EEAS upholds a strict policy of equal opportunity for all applicants. The service promotes diversity and inclusion across its workforce and prevents discrimination based on gender, ethnicity, disability, or other grounds. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to inform the recruitment team in advance to ensure reasonable accommodation throughout the selection process. Application and Selection Procedure The selection process is conducted in three stages: Step 1: Application Applicants should submit the following documents in English or French: A Europass-format Curriculum Vitae clearly indicating the EPSO CAST number or application; A motivation letter explaining suitability for the position; A signed declaration of potential conflict of interest. Applications must be sent by email to: FIELD-SECURITY-RECRUITMENTeeas.europa.eu Email subject line: Call for Expression of Interest RSO EU Delegations  October 2025 Deadline: 19 November 2025 at 12:00 midday Brussels time. Late submissions will not be accepted. All correspondence related to this selection should be directed to: CONTRACTAGENTS-DELEGATIONSeeas.europa.eu Step 2: Pre-selection A selection panel will review submitted applications based on CVs and motivation letters. Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete theoretical and practical tests related to security management. Those who meet the required threshold will proceed to an interview stage to assess competencies and interpersonal skills. Step 3: Selection The selection panel will submit a final shortlist for approval by the Authority Authorised to Conclude Contracts of Employment AACC . The AACC may choose to conduct additional interviews before finalizing the recruitment decision. Inclusion in the reserve list does not guarantee appointment, as recruitment will depend on operational needs and budget availability. For inquiries: CONTRACTAGENTS-DELEGATIONSeeas.europa.eu This opportunity offers a significant role in ensuring the safety and security of EU operations globally through effective risk management and crisis response leadership. Applications should be submitted via email as instructed above before the stated deadline. Apply Now

title: Sun King Hiring Product Security Engineer- Mobile
description: 49 Location: Tatu City, Kenya Department: Global Analytics and Technology Employment Type: Permanent  Full Time Workplace Type: Onsite Reporting To: Head of Cyber Security Company: Sun King Introduction Sun King, a global leader in off-grid solar energy solutions, is inviting applications for the position of Product Security Engineer  Mobile , based in Tatu City, Kenya. This role presents a unique opportunity to join a pioneering organization at the forefront of renewable energy innovation and digital security. As an industry trailblazer, Sun King has connected millions of households to affordable solar power solutions across Africa and Asia, transforming lives by providing clean, sustainable energy access to those without reliable electricity. The organizations success lies in its combination of cutting-edge product design, technological excellence, and a strong social mission. The Product Security Engineer  Mobile will play an instrumental role in protecting Sun Kings mobile ecosystem and ensuring the integrity of its smart devices. This position offers a chance to contribute to a mission-driven organization dedicated to innovation, customer empowerment, and secure technology deployment. About Sun King Sun King is recognized as the worlds leading off-grid solar energy company, integrating advanced product design, fintech innovation, and efficient field operations to deliver energy access to over 1.8 billion people lacking dependable grid connections. To date, the company has illuminated more than 20 million homes , adding over 200,000 new households to solar power each month. Through its pay-as-you-go model, Sun King enables low-income customers to acquire solar products via affordable installment payments, transforming energy consumption across rural and underserved regions. Customers make manageable payments through mobile money systems, ultimately gaining full ownership of their solar systems while enjoying clean, reliable energy. This approach not only reduces dependency on kerosene and diesel but also contributes to significant financial savingsestimated at over 4 billion cumulatively . Each day, Sun King processes more than 650,000 mobile payments through its digital systems and an expansive network of 28,000 field agents . With operations spanning 12 countries and a workforce of over 2,800 full-time staff , Sun Kings expertise covers diverse disciplines, including engineering, data science, software development, logistics, and customer engagement. The company continues to expand its clean technology solutions beyond solar lighting to include clean cooking , electric mobility , and entertainment devices , providing a comprehensive suite of sustainable household and business energy solutions. Sun King upholds a strong commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity . Women make up 44 of its workforce, reflecting the companys dedication to gender balance and equitable representation. About the Role The Product Security Engineer  Mobile will be responsible for identifying and mitigating security vulnerabilities across various vendor smartphones and other connected devices used by Sun King. This role focuses on hardware and software security testing , reverse engineering , and penetration testing to ensure the resilience of Sun Kings mobile devices and embedded systems. The position requires a deep understanding of cybersecurity principles, mobile device management, and hardware hacking methodologies. The successful candidate will actively collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance Sun Kings product security posture, ensuring that every device meets the highest standards of safety and reliability. This is a full-time, onsite role located at Tatu City, Kenya , reporting directly to the Head of Cyber Security under the Global Analytics and Technology Department . Detailed Job Description The Product Security Engineer  Mobile will carry out an extensive range of technical and analytical responsibilities designed to safeguard Sun Kings mobile hardware and embedded software systems. Key Responsibilities: Conduct Offensive Security Assessments The role involves performing offensive security evaluations of Sun Kings mobile hardware, firmware, and embedded operating systems. The engineer will assess potential vulnerabilities in mobile devices and payment stacks, simulating real-world attacks to test system robustness and uncover exploitable flaws. Reverse Engineering of Firmware The position requires proficiency in reverse engineering firmware to identify weaknesses in the code structure. This includes conducting static and dynamic analysis of embedded applications and operating systems to detect security gaps or coding vulnerabilities that could compromise device performance or data security. Vulnerability Identification and Exploitation The engineer will investigate and exploit vulnerabilities within embedded systems, bootloaders, and mobile device management systems. This also includes analysis of Android kernel , secure boot processes , and cryptographic mechanisms to ensure the secure configuration and operation of mobile devices. Proof-of-Concept Development The role entails building and executing Proof-of-Concept PoC attacks that demonstrate the practical exploitability of identified vulnerabilities. These demonstrations will provide tangible insights into potential business impacts and inform necessary security countermeasures. Collaboration with Cross-functional Teams The engineer will collaborate closely with the product development , hardware , and software engineering teams to define and implement secure design and development practices. Through continuous engagement, the role supports the enhancement of product resilience and ensures security is integrated into every phase of product development. Participation in Threat Modelling and Architectural Reviews The role includes involvement in threat modelling sessions and security architecture reviews for new and existing products. By identifying potential risks at the design stage, the engineer contributes to proactive risk management and helps establish a culture of security awareness across teams. Research and Continuous Learning Staying informed about emerging vulnerabilities, security tools, and offensive research is crucial. The engineer is expected to monitor trends and developments in the cybersecurity field, particularly those relevant to smartphone ecosystems , IoT devices , and fintech applications . Technical Scope and Expertise The Product Security Engineers scope covers multiple facets of cybersecurity, including hardware penetration testing, mobile system evaluation, and firmware forensics. Specific areas of expertise that will enhance performance in this role include: Comprehensive understanding of Android security , IoT architectures , and mobile device management systems . Practical experience with hardware hacking methodologies such as JTAGSWDUART debugging , side-channel analysis , and fault injection . Use of reverse engineering tools like Ghidra , IDA Pro , and Binary Ninja for deep firmware analysis. Familiarity with hardware interfacing and debugging tools such as JTAGulator , OpenOCD , and Bus Pirate . Exposure to secure boot technologies , Trusted Platform Module TPM , Trusted Execution Environments TEE , and flash encryption techniques . Proficiency in scripting and programming languages including Python , CC , and Bash , essential for automating security analysis and exploit development. Capability to work with firmware analysis frameworks such as binwalk , Firmadyne , and QEMU . Understanding of common vulnerabilities such as memory corruption , insecure update mechanisms , and design flaws that can compromise system integrity. Experience with payment or fintech device security , particularly in the context of secure provisioning and data protection. Organizational Impact The work of the Product Security Engineer  Mobile directly contributes to Sun Kings commitment to building secure, trustworthy, and reliable energy technologies. By safeguarding Sun Kings devices from potential threats, the engineer ensures that customers data and financial transactions remain secure, supporting the companys broader mission of technological and social impact. This role not only enhances Sun Kings operational security but also reinforces customer confidence in the reliability of its smart devices. The position is therefore pivotal to maintaining the companys reputation as an innovative and responsible leader in clean energy technology. Workplace Culture and Values Sun King promotes a collaborative and inclusive workplace that values diversity, continuous learning, and personal development. The organization fosters a culture of innovation, where employees are encouraged to explore creative solutions to complex challenges. Through its Greenlight Academy , Sun King provides structured learning opportunities designed to help employees strengthen their technical and leadership capabilities. The company values open communication and cross-departmental cooperation, ensuring every employee can contribute meaningfully to its growth and mission. Sun Kings inclusive approach is reflected in its policies and practices. The companys employment decisions are based solely on experience, skills, and performance , with a firm commitment to fairness and equality. Equal Opportunity Statement Sun King is an equal opportunity employer . The organization recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes individuals based on merit, without discrimination on the grounds of race, color, religion, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, HIVAIDS status, disability, or any other legally protected status. Sun King believes that workplace diversity enriches innovation and strengthens competitiveness, and it continues to build an environment where all employees feel valued and respected. Summary The Product Security Engineer  Mobile position offers an exceptional opportunity for a dedicated cybersecurity professional to engage with cutting-edge technology in a mission-driven organization. The successful candidate will play a key role in fortifying Sun Kings mobile platforms, ensuring that millions of customers across Africa and Asia continue to enjoy secure, affordable, and sustainable energy access. This is an opportunity to apply advanced technical expertise in a role that blends innovation, impact, and purpose. Apply Now

title: NRC Hiring Global Security Manager  ACAPS, Kenya or Netherlands
description: 55 ACAPS, an organization dedicated to improving the quality and effectiveness of humanitarian response through independent and evidence-based analysis, is seeking to recruit a Global Security Manager GSM . This role is critical to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of ACAPS personnel as the organization continues its transition to operating as an independent entity. Established to provide impartial and analytical support to humanitarian actors worldwide, ACAPS specializes in transforming complex data into actionable insights. Its mission is to strengthen humanitarian decision-making and enhance response efficiency through accurate, timely, and contextual analysis. With experts working in various countries, ACAPS delivers valuable crisis assessments and operational analysis to inform and guide humanitarian interventions. As ACAPS moves towards greater autonomy, the organization is building a new core team based in The Hague, reflecting a period of strategic transformation and organizational growth. The Global Security Manager will play an instrumental role in shaping and operationalizing comprehensive safety and security management systems, ensuring that ACAPS staff are supported, protected, and able to operate effectively in a range of global environments. Job Overview The Global Security Manager GSM will be responsible for leading ACAPS global safety and security strategy, ensuring that effective policies, procedures, and operational measures are in place to protect staff, assets, and operations across all locations. The position requires a forward-thinking leader who can develop and maintain a strong culture of security awareness while enabling organizational agility and operational continuity. The GSM will work closely with senior management and field-based teams to identify, assess, and mitigate potential risks. This position reports directly to the Chief Operating Officer and will serve as a trusted advisor to the Senior Management Team SMT , Team Leaders , and Regional Managers . As ACAPS expands its presence and independence, the GSM will ensure that all security risk management systems align with international best practices, donor expectations, and humanitarian principles. The successful candidate will also foster an organizational culture that balances staff wellbeing with proactive security risk mitigation. Key Duties and Responsibilities The Global Security Managers duties will encompass a wide range of responsibilities designed to strengthen ACAPS global safety and security frameworks. These responsibilities include leadership, risk assessment, operational management, and staff capacity building. 1. Leadership and Oversight Provide strategic leadership in the design, implementation, and monitoring of ACAPS safety and security policies and systems. Ensure organizational compliance with established security standards and oversee their consistent application across all ACAPS offices and operational sites. Lead the planning, coordination, and evaluation of security management strategies in collaboration with regional and country-level leadership teams. Maintain close communication with the Chief Operating Officer to ensure that safety and security remain integral to ACAPS broader operational and strategic objectives. Oversee the continuous improvement of organizational preparedness, incident response mechanisms, and contingency planning. 2. Strategic Security Risk Management Develop, implement, and update security risk management strategies tailored to ACAPS global operations, ensuring that risk assessments are comprehensive, contextualized, and actionable. Identify and analyze security threats affecting ACAPS staff, partners, and assets, and provide clear, evidence-based recommendations to mitigate identified risks. Ensure that crisis management and emergency response procedures are up to date, realistic, and well understood by all staff members. Coordinate risk assessments for new operational areas or missions, ensuring that the organization can make informed and responsible decisions regarding staff deployment and activities. Advise the Senior Management Team on emerging security trends, challenges, and mitigation priorities. 3. Operational Security Support Provide real-time advice and guidance to staff and managers on security situations as they arise, including support during incidents or operational disruptions. Develop and oversee systems for security incident reporting, documentation, and analysis to support organizational learning and continuous improvement. Collaborate with relevant departments to ensure that physical office spaces, staff accommodations, and mission travel arrangements adhere to safety and security requirements. Maintain contact with external stakeholders, such as security networks, local authorities, and humanitarian partners, to stay informed of evolving risk contexts and strengthen ACAPS external coordination. Ensure that all staff receive adequate pre-departure security briefings and that high-risk travel or mission assignments are reviewed and approved through appropriate protocols. 4. Building Organizational Security Capacity Foster a culture of shared responsibility for safety and security across all ACAPS departments and teams. Design and facilitate regular training sessions, briefings, and workshops to improve staff awareness and practical security competencies. Support field teams and managers in implementing local security measures and adapting them to dynamic contexts. Build the capacity of regional and field-based focal points to effectively implement risk management procedures and respond to incidents. Promote proactive security communication and information sharing within the organization to enhance preparedness and situational awareness. 5. Advisory and Coordination Functions Act as a key advisor to ACAPS management and country teams on all security matters, ensuring that decision-making processes integrate risk awareness and mitigation strategies. Serve as the focal point for all external communication related to security coordination, representing ACAPS within relevant inter-agency security forums and humanitarian networks. Provide regular reporting to management, outlining key security developments, ongoing challenges, and recommended actions. Collaborate with Human Resources to ensure that duty of care obligations toward staff are met and maintained at all times. Support the development of security budgets and contribute to donor reporting requirements concerning safety and risk management. Qualifications and Experience Candidates for this position are expected to demonstrate a solid background in global security risk management with significant experience in leading safety and security functions across multiple international locations. Proven experience in managing global or regional security operations for an international NGO or similar organization. Strong track record in establishing, implementing, and maintaining comprehensive security management systems. Demonstrated understanding of humanitarian principles and the operational challenges of working in crisis and conflict settings. Experience advising senior management on security strategy, policy, and operational decisions. Strong ability to assess risks accurately and provide practical, proportionate, and enabling mitigation measures. Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build trust and collaboration across culturally diverse teams. Experience in capacity building, including the development and delivery of training materials and staff briefings. Proven ability to manage sensitive information with discretion and professionalism. Familiarity with Information and Communication Technology ICT tools and systems relevant to security management. Willingness to travel internationally, including to locations with elevated security risks, and flexibility to work outside regular office hours when required. Educational Background A Bachelors degree or equivalent in a relevant discipline is preferred. Language Requirements Fluency in English is mandatory, as it is the primary working language within ACAPS. Knowledge of additional languages will be considered an asset, particularly for engagement with diverse field teams and international partners. Contractual Information Position Type: Full-time, 100 contract Reporting Line: Chief Operating Officer Location: Kenya or the Netherlands Hybrid model Start Date: Anticipated in early January Eligibility: Candidates must have the legal right to live and work in the country of appointment. ACAPS offers a flexible and collaborative working environment that promotes innovation, inclusivity, and professional growth. The organization values transparency, accountability, and evidence-based decision-making as core principles guiding its operations. Organizational Context ACAPS operates in a range of humanitarian contexts, providing independent analytical support to organizations involved in crisis response and recovery. Its teams conduct assessments, design analytical frameworks, and generate timely insights that inform humanitarian decision-making. The organizations focus on quality data and rigorous analysis ensures that humanitarian actors are better equipped to understand needs, prioritize interventions, and deliver effective assistance. As ACAPS transitions to a fully independent entity headquartered in The Hague, it is building a core team that embodies its values of integrity, innovation, and analytical excellence. The Global Security Manager will play a critical role in ensuring that the organizations expansion and operational independence are supported by robust and effective safety and security systems. Additional Notes The position requires a proactive and strategic thinker capable of balancing organizational objectives with operational realities. The successful candidate will be expected to cultivate a security culture that emphasizes awareness, preparedness, and accountability, while supporting ACAPS humanitarian mission and operational flexibility. This is an opportunity to contribute meaningfully to a global organization at a pivotal moment in its evolution, strengthening its resilience and ensuring the safety of its dedicated teams working in complex humanitarian environments. Apply Now

title: POA Hiring Field Sales RepresentativeNetwork Engineer
description: 54 Poa!, a leading internet services provider in Kenya, is expanding its workforce and is inviting applications for several positions. The company continues to play a critical role in connecting communities with reliable and affordable internet solutions, and it is seeking individuals with the right expertise, drive, and professional commitment to join its growing team. Field Sales Representative  Kajiado The Field Sales Representative role is designed to expand Poa!s customer base within Kajiado County.
